results.description:
The UX Book Club NYC has been in existence since 2008. We meet every two months to engage in in lively, in-depth discussions of books with the potential for making an impact on the way we think and work in our field.

We’re also a social club interested in building community among like-minded folks hungry for ideas and good talk. We believe in the concept of sharing diverse perspectives as a way toward enhancing personal practice and promoting greater community understanding. No matter your role, the club will provide an opportunity to engage in conversation and learning across disciplines. We read books which span subjects within our field as well as those that bring concepts and ideas from other disciplines including: the strategy and business of design, design theory and history, methodologies and process, experience research and the ethics of UX professionals.

The UX Book Club NYC is part of a collective of UX Book Clubs that have formed in over fifty cities worldwide since November of 2008. For more information about the larger club, please visit the wiki: http://uxbookclub.org/doku.php. Meanwhile, if you’re interested in reading, good talk and learning about new ideas, please join us!

Follow us on Twitter; @UXBookClubNYC. And join our GoodReads group where you can suggest and comment on books: http://www.goodreads.com/group/show/55328.U...
results.name: UX Book Club NYC

results.description:
* Meet People from All Walks of Life *  Ｍeet Locally & Connect Globally *

NEW YORK FRIENDS: 2,900+ New Yokers & 100,000+ International Friends

Best Things in Life are Free!

If you are culture, language, travel, and/or fun lover, and you like to enjoy them for free, this is the group for you!!

If you are a new comer or happen to be traveling to New York, welcome to contact this friendly group also!

We will connect to other non-profit WTC communities worldwide. Wouldn't it be nice if you travel to Europe, Tokyo, Toronto, Hongkong, China, or Thailand, you get to meet lots of local residents there, and they may as well show you around and do the interpretation for you free of charge? Let alone the valuable information, assistance, friendship, and security... It may even facilitate the trips that were originally impossible for many of us.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Global Collaborations for a Better World

We live in an ever-shrinking global village, where modern technologies connect people from any corner of the world in a way and intensity never seen before. We also have the fortune to live in a vibrant city that is home to diverse cultures and people of various ethnic backgrounds.

The goal of this Meetup group is two-fold:

(1) To promote cross-cultural dialogue and cultural/language exchange through a variety of local activities and events, as well as international trips.

(Participation in these events is always optional and the organizers are not charging for service.)

(2) To build a chain of WTC groups worldwide so that you have friends all over the world.

(You get to visit them or participate in group events if you travel there. We will also facilitate on-line events so that you can keep in touch with each other after returning to your home town or get to know people at your travel destinations while you are planning your trip...)

The World Cultures and Travel in New York (WCT-NY) Group gives you an opportunity to experience some of the many international cultures that New York hosts, to share your knowledge of your own cultural heritage with other event participants, and meet new friends and expand horizon while doing so.
results.name: New York Friends

results.description:
OUR MISSION

This Meetup strives to make New York City a Model for 21st Century Democracy. We are committed to using technology to build a scalable, sustainable, flexible platform designed to engage more New Yorkers in their local democratic process, that can then be used to serve the Nation and inspire others globally.

Never before has local government thrown its weight behind a platform that truly embraces the ideals of ‘by the people, for the people.’ Here, we will continue our conversation around the underlying question:

How can we build a platform that will…

…engage people more actively in the civic life of their communities
…reinvent the way we communicate with each other about elections
…be ‘government-approved’ yet built and operated outside of government bureaucracy
…do all of this in a way that is scalable and sustainable, creating a model that can be adopted by other cities worldwide?

BACKGROUND

21st Century Democracy is an outgrowth of the important work of the NYC Campaign Finance Board, the parent of the NYC Voter Assistance Advisory Committee, which is leading this effort.


We launched the project in November 2011 with a special town hall event hosted by Brian Lehrer and broadcast live on WNYC, gathering activists, scholars, political professionals and New Yorkers across the five boroughs to explore the question, “Why vote?” Over 1 million listeners tuned in by radio and live stream, and hundreds participated in this large-scale brainstorming session via text and tweet.

Over the coming weeks, the group plans to lay out a technology roadmap that will identify the tools and skills needed to approach a project of this magnitude.

ABOUT

The New York City Campaign Finance Board (CFB) is a nonpartisan, independent city agency that enhances the role of New York City residents in elections. The CFB’s mission is to increase voter participation and awareness, provide campaign finance information to the public, enable more citizens to run for office, strengthen the role of small contributors, and reduce the potential for actual or perceived corruption.

The Voter Assistance Advisory Committee (VAAC), was created by an amendment to the New York City Charter in 2010, to advise the New York City Campaign Finance Board on increasing voter participation and awareness, with special attention to groups and communities of residents that are underrepresented among voters, including civil rights and disabled groups. Under the leadership of its Chair, Art Chang, VAAC has also formed a Digital Action Working Group (DAWG) to identify and connect with partners in New York City’s non-profit and technology communities who will help make this vision a reality.

Art Chang, Chairman of the Voter Assistance Advisory Committee and board member of the NYC Campaign Finance Board. Art is a serial entrepreneur who has helped create and restart over 30 private and public sector organizations. He is the founder and CEO of Tipping Point Partners, an "institutional entrepreneur" that serves as a seed investor and founder of software startups that build bridges between new technology and human needs, with a particular focus on using disruptive technologies to transform existing industries and government. Tipping Point believes that great software, applied intelligently, can result in positive social and economic change.  

Art serves as CEO of two of Tipping Point's portfolio companies: Cookstr, a technology company dedicated to cooking and food, serving as a data-centered "Switzerland" for rights holders; and AppOrchard, an iOS development and software company that bridges the gap between consumer Apple devices and the needs of large enterprises. He also serves as an advisor to Case Commons and to NYU’s Catherine B. Reynolds Fellowship for Social Entrepreneurship. Art has worked as an investment banker, public official and venture capital investor. His sector experience includes technology, e-commerce, media, architecture, real estate, law, government and finance. Art is a graduate of Yale University, where he majored in Women's Studies, and received an MBA in Finance from NYU's Stern School of Business.
results.name: 21st Century Democracy & Technology

results.description:
We've started this group for local dogs of all breeds to get out and enjoy a walk in the park. Pit bulls and bully breeds are welcome! Don't have a dog? Adoptable dogs and fosters are welcome, as well and have them wear an adopt me vest!

Mission Statement

The purpose of Positive Pittie Pack Walk (PPPW) is to create a structured environment to exercise and socialize our dogs. We recognize the importance of being responsible dog owners in order to raise confident, stable dogs, while working towards improving the image of pit bull type dogs. We welcome all types of dogs, and encourage owners who are working on reactivity and socialization issues to join us. Our dogs are always in training, and PPPW strives to be a constructive experience for every dog and his owner, regardless of what issues they are working through.

In order to achieve our goals, all members must abide by the following rules. There will be no exceptions. Anyone who cannot abide by these rules will be asked to leave the group.

No dog interactions: at no point before or during the walk shall dogs be permitted to greet one another, sniff each other, etc. There will be no physical interaction between the dogs whatsoever. It is the rhythm of walking together as a pack that is a positive, dog-social experience. To that end, structured pack walking can be an incredibly therapeutic, rewarding experience for a dog. However, if you are looking for a group where your dog can “meet” new dogs and play, this is not the group for you.

Minimum one handler per dog: one human per dog, and one dog per human. Extra humans welcome to help organize the pack!

Respect Space: when we begin our walks, we will aim to keep approximately 5 feet between each dog. As the walk progresses, and the dogs get into the groove of pack walking, the distance between the dogs will likely reduce. Towards the end of the walk many dogs may end up walking side by side. Although, some dogs may require additional space throughout the entire walk.

Follow Instructions: A few organizers will be navigating throughout the pack as we move along. If an organizer asks you or your dog to move up towards the front or hang towards the back, please do so, and don’t take it personally! The goal is to find where each dog fits in to the pack most comfortably, and modify accordingly. Every dog will be different.

No Retractable Leashes: in order to ensure that each handler has proper control of his or her dog, please use leashes of no longer than 6 feet, and leave the retractable ones at home.

Respect Local Laws and Ordinances: At no time will PPPW violate local leash laws, and all owners are expected to clean up after their dogs. Furthermore, please be sure that your dog has the proper licenses and vaccinations displayed on his collar before joining the group.
results.name: Positive Pittie Pack Walk

Founded by Dr. Paul Foster Case in the 1920s, Builders of the Adytum is a Mystery School and training order based on the Western Mystery tradition. This Qabalistic path has been described as the Yoga of the West, as it has much in common with esoteric Eastern spiritual practices. B.O.T.A. members receive lessons in the mail in Tarot, Qabalah, Spiritual Alchemy, Esoteric Astrology and related disciplines. The coursework is challenging, far-reaching and immensely practical for everyday life.

B.O.T.A. Study Group is a great introduction to Qabalah and esoteric Tarot. It's free and open to the public.

Newcomers are welcome to join in our discussions. No advance preparation is necessary; you need only bring your interest, imagination and inquiring mind. We hope to see you soon!

Group Ritual Work is also available to New York B.O.T.A. members. Sometimes described as prayer in motion, ritual work has been practiced throughout the ages by spiritual aspirants. Combined with the lesson material, it can be a powerful catalyst to personal growth. After completing the requisite initial coursework, members may request Initiation and thereafter participate in our healing ritual work of Pronaos.
results.name: B.O.T.A. New York Qabalah & Tarot

Dramatic Adventure Theatre has a semi-regular event called THE TRAVELOGUE where we 'meetup' to share a few beers, lots of laughs, and some quality stories from the road. We started this meetup group in the hopes of finding other travelers who enjoy sharing their adventures as much as we do.

THE TRAVELOGUE is essentially an open mic night for travel stories but we always have about 4-5 pre-curated stories ready to go. If you'd like one of these slots, let us know! Otherwise, we'll pull names from a hat if you decide in-the-moment that you want to share.  In addition to sharing stories informally during drinks before and after the event, you may be one of the 3-4 randomly selected shares! 

This is a fun, casual opportunity to share a unique story from your travels (domestically, internationally, or even from one side of the city to the other). A Travelogue can simply be a story told, but it also can take the form of a read: journal entry/ blog, a shared photo/ souvenir, a recited poem/ song, or even a played video. 

WHO SHOULD JOIN? Those who are interested in travel. And those who are interested in hearing and, or sharing stories from the road.

NOTE: You do not need to be an artist or public speaking expert to attend these events, this is just a group of people getting together to share. The atmosphere is casual and conducive to organic storytelling.

http://www.dramaticadventure.com
results.name: NYC Travelogue Meetup Group, hosted by Dramatic Adventure

results.description:
Are you an entrepreneur planning to woo professional or Angel investors? Does your job require frequent presentations or public speaking tasks? Has your Headhunter told you that your resume is outstanding, but you interview poorly? The 21-century demands so much more from everyone involved in business. The late Steve Jobs has changed the world of business in an almost unnoticed but highly disruptive way. All members of an organization are now expected to act as branding agents for products. Look at CES 2012, thousands of behind the scenes men and women were expected to create a “REALITY DISTRORTION FIELD” for new products. Even today’s investors want to invest in someone who can sell their product with charisma. In a google-based world, features and benefits presenting and selling will ensure professional failure.

In this world you need an edge! Expect a warp speed jump in your ability to present, persuade, lead others (leadership) and get your ideas across to an audience of one or many. Face-to-face communication is where term sheets are traded.

Effective Pitching and Presenting NEEDS Persuasion Knowledge

This NOT just another meetup group, but expect a doorway into high horse power persuasion training. You will learn to design, package and deliver your message for any audience. Persuasion science— All communication is Brain to Brain. Would you ever use an ATM blindfolded? Why would you conduct important communications without first understanding how your words and body affect other brains. When persuasion is done right, it is absolutely invisible to your audience. Persuasion is about moving your audience attention and viewpoint towards your goals.

Build Amazing Self-expression skills with Stage presence

Pitching with Persuasion Art and science

Investor motivations recognition and message packaging

Narrative crafting

Subliminal communication

Defeat Fears and Anxieties 

This meetup group is your opportunity to overcome fears and anxieties around public presentations using rapid change techniques. We do NOT use quick motivational fixes were you fall flat on your face the next day.

Get Fast Results

A number of accelerated learning formats are used to help you achieve your communication goals in a cost and time effective manner. We use a learn-by-doing process of running simulations that mirror the conditions you must present within.

Team pitching will also be covered—do you have a team or group of people that must present to investors. Come as a group and train in your roles and skills together.
results.name: Pitching Presenting Persuasion LAB

results.description:
Welcome to QUEST! Motorcyclers!

QUEST! isn't an acronym. QUEST! is simply the gathering of people whom enjoy motorcycling adventures in whatever form they may appear! All types of motorcycles are welcomed. BMW, Ducati, Harley-Davidson, Kawasaki, Victory, Honda, Indian, Can-Am, Yamaha, etc.. You must be licensed, insured, & be a responsible experienced motorcycle rider.

 

Picture this in your mind… It’s a warm, sunny Saturday morning in June. Temps are expected to hover around 75 degrees. You’ve had difficult days at work last week & between piano lessons & baseball practice for the kids you’ve been running non-stop. You just changed the oil in the car and just sat down to relax and maybe have an ice cold one. As you reach into the fridge for what you thought was the last can of the six-pack you realize that you polished it off the nite before. Arrrgh! You’re on empty! As you grab the car keys to head out to the local 7-11 your smartphone chimes. It’s an alert that a brand new QUEST! Meetup is happening in a few hours. There’s a ride to a classic car show at Bear Mountain and the Budweiser Truck (along with the Smoothie King truck for you non beer drinkers) will be there! There will be live music too!

You can almost taste the ice cold fizz of the King of Beer’s sliding down the back of your parched throat…but you haven’t started your bike all week. The chrome is dusty, you haven’t checked your tire pressure in weeks, and you need to top off your tank. The QUEST! riders are meeting to ride up to Bear Mountain together so you gotta BOLT!  You say to yourself "It’s never just a “Meetup” with that group" so this may turn out to be a great day! Where's my microfiber cloths?  Where's my wallet?  Where are the keys to my bike? I think I’ll put a hold on that frosty brew until I see the QUEST! riders. It's more fun with that merry band of misfits anyway..."

You can finish the story above any way you choose. We've played it out a hundred times since we began riding motorcycles. Whether in New York, Louisiana, Florida or Colorado. Motorcycle riders enjoy others who also ride! Motorcycle riders are a very tight knit bunch. You don’t have to know the lady rider at the traffic light sitting on her bike waiting for the light to change. You give her a nod and a smile through your helmet. She’ll smile back, give you the two finger flip and off you go! That’s why I created QUEST!. To answer the call to RIDE!

 

Excitement. Laughs. Pure enjoyment of the road.  These are some of the things you'll be a part of with Quest!  Below are a few more...

 

The Call to Adventure - Motorcycle rides will be our core focus! Long or short. Interstate or out of state. Day trips, over-nighters or weekend runs. QUEST! will also participate in some motorcycle rallies as a group. (Americade, Laconia, Roar to the Shore, etc..) With the “official” riding season lasting only seven (7) months, only active riders may suggest Meetups. We want you to be an ACTIVE member of QUEST! After 60 days of inactivity, riders whom have not participated in a ride will be removed indefinitely from the Meetup. I’m not so interested in the number of riders whom join QUEST! as I am with building a great motorcycle riding collective! Join to ride.

The Journey – Launching out before dawn for a leisure ride to Pt. Pleasant, NJ for a day at the beach. Riding to Central Park Summer Stage to lounge on the Great Lawn to watch a free concert. Exploring twisties in the Catskills & Adirondack Mountains of NY State. Riding through Mount Pocono, Pennsylvania & Delaware Water Gap. From Springtime motorcycle maintenance opportunities where a certified motorcycle mechanic will be available to answer questions about your bike to Summertime rides for Maine Lobster and Philly Cheese Steaks in Philadelphia, to Fall foliage runs...the journey begins with QUEST!

The Return – If you ride you know that visiting places by motorcycle is better than seeing them from the inside of an automobile. The freedom that motorcycling offers is like nothing else. The wind. The sounds. The scents. The open road. After a long day of riding we’ll pause to gather our thoughts of the day and bid farewells. Each ride is expected to offer something new. Every return home to our families and loved ones is a successful ride. Come on out and join QUEST! As a QUEST! rider you will be more than just a rider. As adults we all have various experiences & talents which may lend themselves to a better QUEST! experience.

 

QUEST! Motorcycle Group is built upon 5 Core Principles:

A) Individual Respect & Integrity – If these 2 principles need explaining then QUEST! isn’t for you.

B) Personal Safety – Assuring that your Motorcycle is in good working order and you're wearing proper motorcycling gear, equipment and that all your NYS DMV papers are current and in order. This not only protects you as a rider, but your fellow Quest! riders and other travelers on the road.

C) Responsible Ridership - YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR OWN ACTIONS & BY REQUESTING TO JOIN QUEST! MOTORCYCLERS, UPON APPROVAL YOU AGREE TO THE TERMS THEREIN!  YOU RIDE AT YOUR OWN RISK!  QUEST! MOTORCYCLERS NOR ITS LEADERSHIP TEAM ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY IF YOU'RE HURT BEFORE, DURING OR AFTER PARTICIPATING ON A RIDE.   RECKLESSNESS WILL NOT BE TOLERATED DURING A RIDE.  IF IT IS NOTICED THAT YOU ARE CAUSING A HAZARD TO OTHER QUEST! RIDERS YOU WILL BE ASKED TO LEAVE!  NO EXCEPTIONS!

D) TeamWork & Good Sportsmanship - No one rider/member is bigger than the collective Group. Period!  We are a team!  We are one.  No one gets left behind.  We ride for fun! That's what the QUEST! experience is all about!  Let's enjoy the QUEST!

E) Respect For The Ride - Ride & Have A Great Time!

 

In sum, my endeavor in creating QUEST! is that each journey impact member lives positively. Have you ever heard the saying “Ride to Live, Live to Ride"? I believe every person may be at different places in their lives where anything can impact them richly or meagerly. With this new Meetup I hope riders who join will enrich my life & yours…but only if we’re courageous enough to allow ourselves to truly embrace… the QUEST!
results.name: QUEST! Motorcyclers

results.description:
Who We Are

We are a group of diverse and dedicated volunteers who bring tennis to at-risk children in public housing communities in Brooklyn.

What We Do

Every Saturday from 12:30 PM - 3:00 PM, May through September, we bring tennis to kids by setting up temporary tennis courts within their communities. Currently, we operate in five housing developments: Marcy, Sumner, Lafayette Gardens, Brevoort, and Tompkins.

Each community comprises a tennis "club", with its own team jersey and volunteer group. At the end of each season, we hold a Youth Tennis Jamboree, a competition for all of the tennis clubs. We give out T-shirts, award trophies, blast music, and serve food!

In addition to teaching tennis, we engage our students through discussions about communication, healthy eating, school, values, and the environment. We also take our students on unique field trips to educational sites throughout New York City.

We Have Fun, Too!

We help children, have fun, and make friends! We organize year-round social events for our volunteers, including happy hours, hitting sessions at local tennis clubs, coffee tastings, dinners, and more.

Join Us

We will return to bringing tennis to the kids in Spring 2016. Register on our website: www.kingscountytennisleague.org/volunteer to learn about training, the 2016 season timeline, social events, and more. Tennis experience is helpful but not required to volunteer with us.

About Kings County Tennis League 

Kings County Tennis League (KCTL) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to using tennis as a vehicle for youth development and community building in Brooklyn's public housing communities. KCTL was founded in 2010 by Michael McCasland, a forensic scientist who lived in the neighborhood and saw the unused tennis court at Marcy Houses as an opportunity for children. Today, KCTL reaches over 200 children ages five through 15 with the help of approximately 100 volunteers.
results.name: Kings County Tennis Volunteers

results.description:
Izakaya Hunters; recreating Tokyo Nightlife in NYC...

Thanks for checking out this group (and joining?). I'm using the vast amount of Japanese pubs in the NYC area to recreate typical nights in Tokyo. Whats better then taking a couple hours to share some drinks and Japanese small plates and forget about the outside world with a good group? Maybe after we can belt out some tunes at a Karaoke house, or play some billiards, or go to another Izakaya?

Also, this group has become very diverse in the events we hold. Outside of weekly happy hours and weekend Izakaya hang outs we have participated in a wide variety of other cool, Japanese-centric things. Some of the events we have attended include:

  • Japan Block Fair
  • Concerts (Japanese)
  • Ramen Contests
  • Sake/Shochu Tastings
  • Japanese food fairs and tasting events.
  • Trips to the Japanese market.
  • Other Asian restaurants.
  • Izakaya crawls.
  • Asian film festivals.

"Is this a Japanese food club?"

No not exactly. Actually in Izakayas the spirits get the spot light. The food is complimentary to the sake, shochu, and beer. That doesn't mean you need to be a raging alcoholic to join. I myself am not a big drinker. But this is a pub based group. Still Japanese food lovers should do OK with this group too as we have visited many Japanese restaurants. I also like to include some nightlife when the group is not ready to go home. Its not unusual to end up singing karaoke, shooting pool, or finding a roof top bar and enjoy the view.

I hope this explains the group. If you have any questions, suggestions, event ideas, or Izakayas you want to visit let me know!

-Cory

 

*Anti Flake Policy* If you RSVP to an event and are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group. It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending."

 

*About Izakayas*

http://kampai.us/how-to-izakaya
results.name: IZAKAYA HUNTERS

results.description: The future of content on the web – content that gets discovered, creates value, and builds audiences – is not cheap text cranked out by content farms. It's high quality, editorial and entertainment created by experienced journalists and passionate bloggers. The future is a social media world, where humans are the arbiters of quality, and search algorithms reward sharing and human readability. The Internet means publishers should no longer be confined to the limits of in-office staff, nor should they be forced to burn fuel to put reporters on the ground around the world. Creative talent lives everywhere; it can and should work from wherever it lives. And any quality publisher should have access to it. Though we may live far apart, the web can bring freelancers together into a community whose value far exceeds the sum of its members. This is the freelance revolution. The Freelance Writers Meetup is a community of freelance writers who are changing the way content is created, published and distributed. Quality is king. Freelance is the future.
results.name: Freelance Writers Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to Oneness Harlem!

We are Awakened Oneness Blessing Givers living in Harlem New York.

Awakening to Oneness

The Oneness Blessing, also called Deeksha is a Transmission of Energy from the Divine with the intent to move you into a higher state of consciousness.


We would love for you to become Awakened

– to not have any more personal suffering

– to be living in the present moment

– to  experiencing peace and calm throughout your day.

Your becoming Awakened is a very easy process:  1 ) Talk to us, ask us questions about Awakening and being Awakened;  2) listen to the answers to your questions, this will allow our brains to sync up; and 3) receive the Oneness Deeksha from us.  This will accelerate  the process of Awakening for you and you will become Awakened within a few hours to a few months.

The Oneness Deeksha or Oneness Blessing can be received in person as a hands on the head energy transfer,  it can be received in a chat session or via a video webcast.

Come to Meetups at our home to receive The Oneness Deeksha Blessing


BENEFITS OF DEEKSHA

Evolution in one’s consciousness manifests as changes in all spheres of our life – health, wealth, relationships & spiritual growth. The Deeksha brings about a growth in consciousness, thus heightening your life experience. The Deeksha changes emotions and perceptions or helps one be free of perceptions. This shift changes one’s approach to challenges and opportunities since when perceptions change one no more perceives a problem as a problem. When perceptions change reality may also change because the external world is merely a reflection of the inner world. Higher perceptions and positive emotions create a more successful and fulfilling life.

Effort does have a role in the Deeksha. While effort in the form of introspection, contemplation, asking the right question, having an intent, external doing etc. is also essential. The role of effort in this context is analogous to a plane speeding on a runway to take off, but the actual take-off also demands an appropriate wind current. The Deeksha is like the current that finally lifts the plane off the ground.

Deeksha is given by the laying hands on the recipient’s head or sometimes through intent. In this case, the giver holds the receiver in his or her awareness for a few minutes and allows the Deeksha to flow. In this way, the Deeksha can be given at a distance of thousands of miles or to a large group of people all at the same time. Deeksha unfolds differently in every individual as it depends on what the receiver may need it most.

These are some of the common benefits in receiving a Deeksha as reported by the recipients. One can experience greater effects of it with prolonged exposure.

· Awakens creative potentials, abilities and intelligence
· Increases ability to learn
· Resolves inner conflict leading to inner peace and harmony
· Brings love to relationships
· Heals emotional hurts and reduces thought burden
· Evokes affection, friendship and a sense of connectedness with the other.
· Awakens compassion
· Infuses vitality
· Heals the body by healing the mind
· Relaxes the body and relieves stress
· Helps build love and appreciation for the body
· Invokes auspicious energies
· Removes blocks that hinder success
· Makes possible a mental frame for abundance
· Initiates a journey into experiencing unconditional love and joy
. Initiates a journey into Awakening and God Realisation

http://www.onenessuniversity.org


ONENESS BLESSING or DEEKSHA

The central understanding of Oneness is that inner transformation and awakening into higher states of consciousness is not an outcome of a mere intellectual understanding but through a shift in consciousness whereby one’s experience of life is redefined at its core. This is achieved by the process of the Oneness Deeksha /Oneness Blessing which is a phenomenon sourced in the deep passion and the intent of Sri Amma & Sri Bhagavan.

Oneness Deeksha (aka) Deeksha is an energy transfer that brings about growth in consciousness. The level of consciousness of a person determines his/her quality of life experience. For instance, one’s experience of the ongoing recession, the ability to handle misunderstanding in relationship or a daughter’s rebellious nature, what emotions surge through when diagnosed with a health problem, the level of connection with people around and the joy experienced, the intensity of passion at work etc., depend on one’s level of consciousness. As consciousness rises, there is greater awareness, joy, love, togetherness, and focus in everything that you do and experience.

The Deeksha neither requires practicing a particular way of living nor is an initiation into following a new path. It does not bind one to any philosophy or ideology. It transcends religious and cultural barriers from the fact that it only chooses to awaken each to his/her own spiritual tradition by facilitating a neuro-biological shift, thus making religion a matter of personal choice and convenience. Hence people belonging to any faith or age group can receive the Deeksha.

The Oneness Deeksha or Oneness Blessing can be received in person as a hands on the head energy transfer, it can be received in a chat session, via a video webcast, or even over the phone.

Group History: 

This group was NYC Stress Reduction & Abundance Meditation Group

This group was originally started by Rosario Mazer (Awakened Oneness Trainer) and Vera L. Angelico for the purpose of providing The Oneness Blessing or Deeksha in Midtown Manhattan and met on Tuesdays.  They have both moved away.  The group continued in midtown Manhattan for some time after they left ( led by the Awakened Oneness Harlem blessing givers) until the midtown location was no longer available.  Oneness Harlem used to meet on Mondays  until it too no longer had a meeting space.
results.name: Oneness Harlem

We have a dedicated group of networkers who are committed to helping each other grow their businesses and build a network of resources for their clients, referral partners, and friends.

Business Events NY welcomes Business owners, Entrepreneurs, Marketing Directors, Business Professionals, and anyone looking to grow their network and business.

Here’s some more information about Business Events NY:

    Our networking events draw anywhere from 150 to 300 professionals.

    Our group is particularly popular with the finance, marketing, real estate, technology, law, and entertainment industries.

    We host breakfast panels, afternoon roundtables, evening seminars, and cocktail mixers to accommodate our audience’s availability.

    We promote our events through social media, press releases, news publications, Eventbrite, and Meetup.com.

We hope to see you at an upcoming mixer! Don't hesitate to email our Marketing & Events Manager, Elle, if you have any questions: Events@AjaxUnion.com

results.description:
ScreenUps are live events for media professionals to connect, watch amazing short-form films and gain insights from innovators in video storytelling worldwide.

Hosted by Storyhunter, the premier network for video production in over 170 countries, Screenups began in Dumbo, Brooklyn in 2012 by a group of creative directors, filmmakers and journalists seeking to break the silos in media and advertising. It's a time for like-minded video storytellers to learn each other and share experiences.

If you have a video or filmmaker we should showcase, nominate them here!  

If you are a production company, media company, agency or event space, bar or restaurant, submit to become a ScreenUp host here. 

Past presenters include senior producers from National Geographic, AJ+, MSNBC, Discovery Digital, The New York Times, including leading creative agencies, filmmakers and production companies. The film selection has no geographic boundaries with filmmakers often joining via video chat to from the farthest reaches of the planet. Videos are anywhere from 1-15 minutes long. 

At a typical ScreenUp, there will be time for networking, a quick screening and Q&As with filmmakers to learn about the video production process, innovative projects and relevant issues in the industry.

Come join the movement!

Alex Ragir, co-founder of Storyhunter

I also realized, that since being natural I have enjoyed the company and advice of many other naturals - but my issue - natural hair meet ups tend to be in Brooklyn or Manhattan! So I figured, why not start a meet up group right here in Long Island.  Please note, you don't have to be a Long Islander to join this group - you don't have to be a natural to join this group, you just have to be willing to socialize and meet new natural hair people!  I'd like this group to develop into a bi-monthly social gathering where we can learn from each other, discuss natural hair, products, and learn to grow healthy hair!

Each company has a maximum slot of 20 minutes to present followed by a Q&A session for a further 10 minutes. results.description:
This meetup is part of LaunchNJ but all events and functions will be tailored to meet the needs of the local community.

Formed and run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs.

Our Mission: The creation of a vibrant entrepreneurial community in New Jersey so that entrepreneurs have the necessary tools available to launch their startups.

Collaboration: We are a collaborative movement which is looking to work with any group that shares our passion for entrepreneurship. We are not in competition with NYC, Philly or any other group.

Necessary Tools:

• Developers & Business Development professionals: building blocks of an entrepreneurial community

• CoWork Spaces: Melting pots in which companies are started

• New Blood/Ideas/Energy: Collaborate with teaching institutions and make entrepreneurs who are working in silos aware of the community

• Educational Collaboration: Incubators, accelerator, entrepreneurial programs, STEM in high schools etc…..

• Investors: They don’t think we have enough quality companies in NJ to warrant their time. Let’s prove them wrong.

• Government: We don’t expect a lot but every little bit helps. Helping with cowork spaces is a good start.

Past & Present:

New Jersey is the home of Thomas Edison, Bell Labs and was the epicenter of the Pharmaceutical industry and Telco. We also have a highly educated population, great businesses, close proximity to NYC and/or Philly and a well-developed educational system. However, if you look at lists of top states for entrepreneurship and innovation New Jersey never makes it. The great thing is that this is showing signs of changing. NJ Tech, Jersey Shore Tech and Princeton Tech have proven, by their stellar growth, that New Jersey wants/needs an entrepreneurial ecosystem.

LaunchNJ (Not for profit):

Madison Tech has pivoted and is now called LaunchNJ. Our sole mission is the creation of an entrepreneurial community in New Jersey. This group is run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs so we figured it only made sense to run it like a startup. We will take chances, measure results and iterate or pivot as needed.

MVP:

Use the voice of LaunchNJ to support the creation of Special Interest Groups (SIG’s): (i.e. Life Sciences, Developers, Female Entrepreneurs)

Create events that provide high value for entrepreneurs: (workshops, deep dives, co-founder date night etc.)

Make members aware of events occurring around the state (aggregate)

Celebrate New Jersey company wins =’s create buzz

The Bottom Line:

New Jersey has all the building blocks necessary to build an entrepreneurial and innovation hub, the movement has started. Since this is a grassroots movement we need you. None of the organizers are getting paid but they are working hard to deliver high impact programs and will continue to do so. However, if we are to succeed we need your help. Please let other entrepreneurs or entrepreneurial people know about the group. It is a great opportunity for them to learn and you are helping your community.

Definitions:

Entrepreneurial: A person who sees a problem and fixes it without having to be told and is willing to share knowledge with others.

Entrepreneur: An Entrepreneurial Person who chooses to take the plunge and commit themselves 100% to something that has a high probability of failing.
results.name: LaunchNJ: Montclair Tech and Media Startups

results.description: In a society that forces us to live from our minds, we have forgotten what it means to be connected to the rest of our selves. It's not that the mind is evil, but that we can learn to integrate other parts of ourselves into our way of understanding and interacting with our world. Reconnecting to our body and our emotions, allowing ourselves to have ALL of ourselves (and not just the parts that we have somehow learned "should" be there) brings us incredible levels of energy, confidence, intuition, creativity, trust, pleasure, love, intimacy, and pure JOY. Our lives become fuller, richer and more connected. We will gather to discuss ways in which we can take an inner tour of our emotional, energetic, and physical bodies; by-passing our thinking brain and building awareness and compassion through tantric and shamanic rituals, sharing circles, dancing, shaking, meditation and any other techniques members bring into the equation. If you are ready to let go of B&W, and step into Technicolor... This is the meetup for you!

results.description:
Are you tired of feeling uncomfortable, when you are out at social events, and choose not to consume alcohol?

If you are looking to socialize, and network, in positive, uplifting, serene surroundings, then please join us.. You will enjoy a wide range of non-alcoholic events , including brunches,  after work mixers,  picnics in the parks, tea ceremonies and more, where the emphasis is on getting to know one another, not getting wasted.

This is a singles network for individuals who want an alternative to social events  that take place in noisy venues where the cocktails are flowing, and the music is loud and annoying.

If you're a business and/ or creative professional who would like to join our community, please provide a recent picture, and share some background information. Thank you!

I started this group, after attending several meetups where alcohol was served  It was so raucous,  we could not even hear each other.  For the record, I have been promoting partying sans booze, here in the NYC metro area, since 1992.

I do not hold any of these alcohol-free events in bars or clubs, as the atmosphere is just not right. The events for this group, and my other meetup, the Smart Party NYC's #1 Alcohol-Free Social Network, are held in tea salons, yoga or dance studios, community spaces and juice bars, where the vibe is refreshing, vibrant and healthy.

Celebrities and entertainers who now enjoy alcohol/drug free lifestyles will be invited to future venues.

If you are looking for the #1 groups, for socializing without alcohol, in the NYC area, that would be this one, and our associate group, the Smart Party NYC's #1 Alcohol -Free Social Network.

I do not spend my  time organizing other events, parties and mixers where liquor is served.

There is another meetup (with a similar name to this one)  that does just that, in an attempt to mix non drinkers (of alcohol) with those who are throwing back regular cocktails, beer, wine, etc.

Talk about missing the point! The main reason I started these alcohol-free social groups was to provide New Yorkers with vibrant, exciting, creative alternatives to the kind of noisy, booze-filled clubs in which those organizers hold their events. You cannot label your event an "Alcohol-free Social," when you are also offering regular alcoholic drinks, at the same venue. Ridiculous!

I'll look forward to hearing from you, with regards to ideas about future meetups.

Thank you for your interest.....

Best, Lynn Earley/Organizer

 

 

Who says you can't have fun without alcohol?

*******This is the Original  ********Alcohol Free Socials Group

Not affiliated with the group: Alcohol-Free Socials/Fitness/Meditation ..started by a former member of my other meetup, the NYC Smart Party....We do not hold our alcohol-free events in bars. Ever.
results.name: Alcohol Free Socials for Health Conscious Singles

results.description:
It's Tech@NYU's monthly party!

At each DemoDay, Tech@NYU members and other NYC students will demo what they've been working on for the last month in the areas of programming and design.

It's a monthly celebration, where Tech@NYU opens it doors to show off what we've been doing.

NYC students - if you'd like to demo your latest hack, project, or pre-funding startup, please contact one of the organizers.

Past demos have included:

  • A Javascript library for calculus and statistics
  • A remote control for human beings
  • A pre-beta version of a student startup that later received $2m in funding
  • LED lights powered by motion-activated bacteria
  • Demonstrations of OpenGL, Box2D, and other libraries

As always, DemoDays is student-only.
results.name: Tech@NYU DemoDays - student code/design demos for students!

results.description:
We’re looking for Choreographers, Dancers, Organizers, and Movement Artists of all kinds who are interested in bringing their art form to the Occupy Movement. A group is forming and will be meeting regularly to incubate ideas for creating dance that aligns with the Occupy movement in either content or form. There’s currently a focus on planning classes, actions, and choreography to be present for the September 15-September 17th Anniversary Weekend of Occupy Wall Street. But most importantly, we’re interested in bridging the gap between socio-political movements and MOVEMENT!

 

Who should join this group? Choreographers, Dancers of all kinds, Dance Enthusiasts! And anyone at all who wants to contribute to the Occupy movement by making it more artful, and more accessible to creative types.

 

Visit "Occupy Dance" and share photo, videos, and more on facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/OWSDance
results.name: Occupy Dance

results.description:
"STOP IN THE NAME OF LOVE, BEFORE YOU BREAK MY HEART ... THINK IT OVER" and come join us for some of the most spectacular Dance Parties and Social Events around! We plan on filling your evenings with fantastic entertainment, dancing and great memories as we travel back to the past with songs from the 60s, 70s 80s, to the present! From the Supremes to the B52's.

Think back when life was simple and innocent. Remember your first crush, your first date, and lets not forget that first kiss!  Throughout it all, we always had the music. Nothing brings us back through the portals of time, to those sweet memories, like the music of that era.  So, let's take a break from today and stroll back down Memory Lane.

Come join a singles group focused  on friendships first. We offer Dancing,  Nightlife, Dinning, Wine Tasting's, Happy Hours, Cocktails & Conversations, Concerts, Plays, Movies, Boat Cruises, Dating, Professional Social Networking,Picnics, Beach Parties, Bowling, Billiards, and Brunches just to name a few!


IMPORTANT NOTE: PLEASE TRY TO POST A PHOTO OF YOURSELF, SHOW AT LEAST YOUR FIRST NAME AND ANSWER THE FEW QUESTIONS POSED. THANK YOU.

This group is open to anyone who's young at heart.

results.description:
Venturing Hoyas is a private group of Georgetown students and alum who are active in entrepreneurship and venture capital. Our mission is to create stronger community within our group, enabling members to meet, share, and collaborate.  We plan to foster this community by hosting a number of social and professional events:

  • Social events: Regularly scheduled happy hours, networking events, etc.  The easiest way for us to quickly build a stronger network, get to know each other, and see if people within the group can be helpful to each other.
  • Demo/Pitch days: Getting members of our community to pitch and showcase their ideas to get constructive feedback
  • Speaker series:  Welcoming experienced Hoya alum within the industry to host private chats with us to discuss their successes and failures
  • Recruiting program: Getting a presence on campus in DC to recruit undergrad/grad students to summer internships and full-time opportunities at startups
  • Mentorship program: Linking more experienced alum with recent graduates and first-time entrepreneurs in their respective industries

You will hear from us as we plan new events but please use this forum to engage with and meet other Venturing Hoyas.

You must be a current or past student or faculty member of Georgetown University to join.

Follow us on twitter: http://bit.ly/AE1TKc

Join our LinkedIn Group: http://linkd.in/w2xbC6
results.name: venturing hoyas

results.description:
I started this group to assemble backpackers for the purpose of finding great folks to section-hike the Appalachian Trail with. Beyond my personal desire to hike the AT, this group is dedicated to everyone who is looking to section hike any part of the trail from Georgia to Maine (this started out as an NYC/NJ/CT group, but we are expanding this group to a National level). If you are an experienced backpacker, join the group and send me a message to become an organizer and attract folks to join you in your own adventures. Whether your trips last for a month or even just a weekend, this is the place to find others with the desire (but perhaps not the time) to hike the AT in its entirety in single trip.

If you are thinking of joining us you will have the following:

  • multi-day backpacking experience
  • You will have your own gear (a backpack, a tent & a sleeping bag)
  • knowledge and skills to set up camp and prepare your own food in the back country
  • Understanding of basic orienteering and first aid
  • 21 years of age or older
  • A healthy appreciation for and respect for the outdoors
  • $1 a year to chip-in for the cost of running this meetup group

My vision for this group is that we would use the meetup as a forum to meet other backpackers in the area who would also like to section-hike the AT. Depending upon your speed, experience and skill level we will ultimately break down into smaller groups and plan multi-day excursions on the AT. If you have section hiked the AT in the past or even better if you have thru-hiked the trail we would be most pleased to have you in our group. Intermediate level backpackers especially are quite welcome (I'm intermediate level myself) - advanced beginners with a willingness to learn are also welcome to join us.

If you are brand new to hiking and backpacking, this group is probably not going to be a fit for you.

About me: My trips will be organized in the Spring and Fall. My trips will be limited to 5 backpackers or less to preserve the wilderness experience for everyone. In 2012, over 20 days and 5 trips I've hiked about 250 miles of New York/New Jersey/Connecticut sections of trail. From here I've decided to continue northwards the 700 miles that I need until I reach Mount Katahdin. I'll be starting out in Salisbury, Connecticut in March or April, 2013 and aiming for Crawford, New Hampshire (I will make it to Wallingford, Vermont by the end of Spring). I hope that some of you will be able to join me on all or part of this adventure!

By joining Appalachian Trail Tri-State Section Hikers Group you agree to the liability waiver that is located in the pages section.
results.name: Appalachian Trail Section Hikers

results.description:
We are an intentional community of artists, healers, teachers, organizers, dreamers and spiritual adventurers. We are looking to enrich our experiences by sharing them. We know that through community we can create something bigger than any one person, and that collective experience can inspire us and fuel us to grow and change.

 

We aim to create an environment that nurtures evolution and self-realization, and we see arts, healing, and spiritual practice as some of the most useful tools for cultivating this garden. We are also interested in connecting the dots between these three tools and discovering what emerges when these practices overlap.

 

Through programming that is centered around this triad, we build a better community and a better sense of ourselves.

 

While many events will take place in Jersey City, we welcome folks in all parts of New York City and New Jersey to join and expand this community geographically. 

If you're doing something that's aligned with us, but have Two-Rivers-itis or NJ-Turnpike-aphobia, join anyway! We have friends, ties and connections as far as Brooklyn and Princeton, and plan to occasionally schedule things in those areas.
results.name: Centered: Evolving Healers and Artists

ALL ARE WELCOME
results.name: Prepare Defend Survive

results.description:
New Jersey needs big changes that help people like you instead of Chris Christie's conservative con-artist gimmicks that benefit the richest one-percent and global corporations. If you are looking for better government service and fair taxes, you have to make sweeping changes in New Jersey's broken political establishment.

Jim Devine has proposed massive changes to cure the Garden State's plague of 'politics as usual' ~ including plans to strip political bosses of their power and eradicate the corrosive influence of dirty money in government. This bold vision will not be popular with the political establishment but it is the right prescription for strong democracy and a better New Jersey.

  • Establish Fair & Clean Elections
    Provide public funds matching small donor contributions six to one and equip other resources to all candidates who demonstrate broad public support and agree not to use or coordinate with dirty money in politics. Billionaires and corporations could still spend as much as they want, subject to full disclosure and a 200% tax that allows all candidates to compete on a level battlefield.
  • Stop Rigging Ballots
    Prohibit candidates from 'bracketing' or otherwise giving anyone an unfair advantage with respect to ballot position. Every American is entitled to equal protection of the law, so candidates picked by party bosses should not get preferential treatment in primaries.
  • Cut Property Taxes in Half
    New Jersey has more than 1,000 municipalities and schools districts that waste taxpayer money with duplication of services and inefficiency. We can have more responsive services and lower cost without the web of politics, corruption and confusion that we have today.
  • Curb Corporate Spending
    Require corporations to obtain specific permission from shareholders prior to making any spending to influence legislation, elections, or public opinion and impose a 200% tax on such expenditures, which would fund Fair & Clean Elections.
  • Open & Honest
    Require full disclosure of funding sources for all political communications. Impose criminal penalties on corporations that make factual misrepresentations in any communications intended to influence legislation, elections, or public opinion concerning government policy.
  • Legislative Reform
    Establish a full-time, unicameral legislature with 60 representatives, who would each be paid $95,000 a year, prohibited from receiving additional earned income and subject to strict conflict of interest rules.
  • Government Efficiency
    Evaluate local government consolidation, such as unifying police and other law enforcement services in a centralized administration to eliminate excess administration and duplication of services. Create a statewide system of free public schools for every child from the age of three to a college degree.
  • Polluters Pay
    Require corporations to rectify environmental damage on property they own or owned and lobby to reestablish the federal Superfund petrochemical industry tax system.
  • Resign to Run
    Stop politicians from using one elected office as a stepping stone to another, wasting your tax dollars and failing to do their job. Any elected official should be required to resign if he or she wants to seek election to another job.
  • No Double Dipping
    Public officials should be barred from holding two or more jobs at taxpayer expense. Our current political establishment is rife with corruption and conflicted interests because politicians are looking out for themselves instead of us.
  • Term Limits
    Career politicians have forgotten that public service is an honor and a privilege. It's time to stop lifetime tenure by making elections competitive and setting limits on the time anyone can hold an elected position.
  • And much, much more!
results.name: Democrat Jim Devine for NJ

We can discuss anything from medications to diet and traveling supplies. Anyone who is a Type 1 or 2 can join. Bring your loved ones and family members. The more, the merrier.

After having this meetup- Diabetics @ West Hills for 3 years, I've decided to expand to NYC too! Meetings will be held in both the city and Long Island. Members are welcome to suggest ideas for meeting places. Welcome to Diabetics @ West Hills/NYC!

results.description:
Greetings Astorians & a warm welcome to visitors of our wonderful neighborhood!

Get-Fit-Astoria is a Run, Bike & Swim group for Astorians by Astorians!

Our primary mission is to connect members of the Astoria community looking to meet and engage with local runners/bikers/swimmers. Whether you're new and simply want to start getting into a routine, or if you're looking to ease back or accelerate your performance and training, someone in our friendly community can help you achieve your goals!

Astoria offers a decent amount of places to run; Astoria Park, Queensboro Bridge (repeats), along Vernon Blvd, etc. There is no shortage of bike routes connecting our small community to the neighboring boroughs. Finally, you can find places to swim in the form of indoor pools (local gyms) & outdoor pools (Astoria Park). If you're looking for open water swimming, sorry, no dice. But we can certainly meet elsewhere! :)

So if you're a local resident or a visiting guest, connect with us and we'll show you around!

Let's Get Fit & Let's Do This, Astoria!
results.name: Get Fit Astoria! (Run Bike & Swim)

results.description:
We are a social running group that enjoys interesting trails, singing ribald songs, drinking beer and sharing a meal afterwards. The Hash House Harriers phenomenon began with the 1st group founded in 1938. There are now over 70,000 members in HHH groups on all 7 continents.*

The Long Island Lunatics Hash House Harriers meet once a month (usually) on the Saturday evening nearest the full moon. Our aim is to bring together Long Islanders and New Yorkers who want to socialize and have a bit of exercise at the same time.

Members come in all shapes & sizes, ages and fitness levels. We cater to the young and old, fast and slow, fit and not-so-fit! Trails are about 3 to 5 miles long. The main prerequisites are a sense of humor, willingness to meet new people, open-mindedness, tolerance and a general sense of fun. However, as drinking is involved everyone must be 21 years old to attend. Also, we are sticklers about not driving drunk.

If this sounds like your cup of tea (or harder stuff), come Run with the Mad Cows!

*More information may be found on the sport of hashing on Wikipedia:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_House_Harriers
results.name: Long Island Lunatics Hash House Harriers

results.description: So, we have this crazy idea that there is amazing, quirky, somber, exciting, and unique LIVE music that's being played, enjoyed and passed on in the Boogie-Down Bronx every day. And we're missing it! If you love live music and are curious about what other music fusions, from Hip-Hop to Gospel to Rock, the gritty, spell-binding, chameleon-like, global Bronx is preparing to birth into the world, come discover the local music scene with us!
results.name: Bronx Music Meetup Group

results.description:
When I was living in SF, I started a Therapist Happy Hour because most of my friends are therapists and it was an opportunity to see everyone. But, what I realized is that so much actually happened in the happy hour. We told one another about jobs coming available, good training to go to (and ones to avoid) and referrals for those in private practice. At this point, I know about 50 amazing therapists and love the idea of great people meeting, connecting and creating community. I hope you come out and feel free to invite your therapist friends to this...the more the merrier.

This is primarily for psychotherapists but students already in the field are also welcome.
results.name: Therapist Happy Hour

results.description:
Co-ed, slow-pitch softball in Central Park!

Softball season is here! We play two games every Sunday.

NOTE: Appalachian Mountain Club membership is required for people who want to join our Meetup group. For info on the local Appalachian Mountain Club chapter, see this link: amc-ny.org. AMC membership fees are $40 for individuals, $60 for families, and only $25 for people under age 30 or seniors aged 70+.

Don’t worry if you feel rusty, or if you have never played before. We encourage a fun, not overly competitive game, where everyone can participate. We even supply the equipment (bats, balls, bases - please bring your own glove).

This is a very friendly game that has become a Central Park fixture. We're now into our third decade, and we've got a loyal group of folks. The game is organized by members of the Appalachian Mountain Club (the nation’s oldest outdoor recreation and conservation organization).

We play every Sunday from late April through early Autumn (and beyond). We meet at 10:30 AM. The first game starts at 11. Then we take a short break and play our second game, finishing by 3. The fee is $5, payable in cash on game day.

Adults of all ages and experience levels play with us. Join us for lunch after the games!

If the forecast temperature for mid-day is 50 degrees or higher, then we will play!

In case of poor weather and field conditions: The ball fields could be closed. Please call the park hotline on game days to confirm field openings: 212-628-1036, extension 331 (for North Meadow dates), 332 (for Heckscher Fields dates), or 330 (for Great Lawn dates).

See you on the field!

results.description:
Mission
To Provide Compassion, Friendship and Fellowship to Individuals who are In or Have Completed the Divorce Process.

This meetup group got its start in September, 2009 when Joe took over a fledgling Divorce Support Meetup Group and Stephen Lesce joined the group in January of 2010. In August of 2012, We decided to be better.

We have a growing group of diverse individuals who like to help each other with issues we are faced with no matter what stage of the divorce process you are in - We welcome anyone who is contemplating, in or have completed the divorce process. We offer Compassion, Friendship and Fellowship and encourage new members to attend any gathering that you want to attend. You may attend any event that you feel like attending, We strongly encourage every member to attend the Monthly Support Meeting at least once.

You will be warmly welcomed When you attend your first meeting, event or outing there is nothing to be nervous about. Depending where you are in the divorce process, you will meet someone, with a compassionate ear and who has been in similar situations in which you find yourself today.

The Monthly Support Meeting usually last for two hours and your only cost is whatever you decide to eat or drink but you are not required. You don't have to talk much either all we ask is that you introduce yourself to the group and let us know what stage you are in the divorce process and what you would like to get out of our meetings.

You will find that you will make lots of new friends who totally "get" what you are going thru and you can feel free to ask the group anything you want and see if anyone has an answer or an opinion.
results.name: New Jersey Complete Divorce Support Group

results.description:
This group has been created to bring people together that love to sing in both Japanese and English to do Karaoke around New York City.  Occasionally, we go to other music and cultural events, such as festivals, street fairs, concerts, etc.

 

All of our members are at least 21 years of age due to the availability of alcohol in the rooms.


Since our members speak both Japanese and English, or are learning either Japanese or English, our meetups will be bilingual (unless otherwise posted.)  We frequently use our meetups as a means of language exchange. Anyone who joins to sing only in English will be removed, as this does not align with the purpose of the group.

 

Some of our favorite places to sing include: Karaoke Duet 48, Karaoke Duet 35, Japas 27, Japas 38 and Japas 55.

 

All of our members are encouraged to set up their own karaoke or music related events.  Any suggestions are welcome.

 

Hope to sing with you soon!

 

 

Group Rules


1) This is a Japanese-English karaoke group, which means you can sing at least 1 or 2 songs in Japanese.  Please do not join if you only want to sing English songs.


2) Please RSVP to the events you attend, or make sure it is okay with the organizer first before coming.  This is due to room-size limitations. The organizers reserve the right to deny anyone entry who shows up without notice.

 

3) Please bring ID with you to all events to prove that you are over 21 years of age.


4) Please go in clockwise order one by one when selecting songs to sing, so everyone has an equal opportunity.  This also makes it easy to tell if your song is skipped, in which case you can choose two songs upon your next turn.  Please try to locate your song choice before getting the remote to keep it moving along.  As soon as you enter your song, please pass the remote directly to the next person, and let them know it is their turn. 


5) Please tip the staff at karaoke.  If it is a marathon, an extra $2 per person is appropriate.  If it is per hour, an extra $1 per person per hour is appropriate.


6) If you leave an event early, please give your payment including tip to the organizer, who will take care of the bill at the end.  Please always bring cash with you to make splitting bills and tipping easier.


7) If you RSVP to an event and are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group.  It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending."
results.name: New York J-Karaoke Group: Sing in Japanese and English!

You know that old letter you read over and over that makes you feel good? Or the ones your parents wrote to one another during the Korean War? Or the one of you with that diploma that reminds you how far you’ve come… or that instrument your father gave you when you were 17 which he received from his father when he was young? This includes business or domain names or related material as your Meetup Username or profile photos that advertise a business.  Please refrain from soliciting our Fellow Hikers for any activity (including other planed hikes) outside of the Wednesday Hiking +Plus group. We are here to maintain a safe and comfortable environment for all our members and such activities will not be tolerated. 

Because not everyone loves your pet like you do and some people are actually allergic to them, we do not allow pets on our hikes. Smoking is not allowed because of fire hazards and it's just not polite in this day and age. If you are a smoker please do so before or after attending our hikes.

NO LITTERING
NO SMOKING
NO PETS

results.description:
Many spiritually awakening individuals are drawn to the entertainment industry.

Why?

Its many challenges and the uncertainty of the pathway is a great way to discover the illusions, insecurities and fears of the mind in order to transcend them. In this sense it is very much a spiritual pathway.

If we are truly to experience a mass shift in consciousness the far reaching potential of the entertainment industry is one of the best ways to create a paradigm shift. In the last few years we have seen a huge upswing in quality, commercially successful entertainment that contains the seeds/vibration of deep metaphysical, spiritual and consciousness shifting material, packaged in a way many can receive, consciously or unconsciously. How subversive and exciting!

"Lost", "Heros", "Fringe", "Avatar" are just a few examples of this.

The entertainment audience are more sophisticated than they have ever been and are ready to receive on this level. Its never been a more exciting time!

By approaching my entertainment career (stand up comedian for 11 years, and actor) with a "spiritual growth" angle and through studying with some great Masters of mind/body/energy connection I was able to unlock some very "mind blowing" techniques that quickly transcend the restrictions of the mind and start activating the power of the soul to manifest in ways that are miraculous, synergistic and divinely inspired.

Right place at the right time is now the luck you can create.

Are you a serious entertainment industry professional, ready to raise the vibration of the biz, learn powerful techniques for manifesting AND be in a supportive collaborative community?

A venue for multi-disciplinary discussions that go beyond quantification of human biologic function to include ideas for how to optimize human performance across multiple domains including physical, mental, emotional and social.

The presentations will span the gamut from the socio-cultural aspects of human health to the technologies and nutritional interventions that can enhance cognition, athletic performance and sense of general wellbeing.

BioHackersNYC takes a broader view of biohacking compared to the original biopunk movement or DIYBio where experimentation with DNA and other aspects of molecular biology was/is a core element.

It is designed to bring together multiple perspectives that can help shift the current health paradigm from an illness focus to a wellness focus.

Anyone interested in the integration of sociology, biology, technology, wellness would find this of interest.

results.description:
Hello, parents or parents-to-be.

Would you like to:

* Meet with like-minded parents and fellow community members

* Build social and health connections

* Establish a supportive Community & Discussion Group

* Nourish and expand your parenting options

* Continue your personal growth to enable you to be the best parent you can be

There are several fantastic play groups in Hoboken, which provide a very valuable resource for parents in town.

But, where can you go to discuss the questions that arise each and every day regarding raising your child?

The Hoboken Holistic Parenting and Family Wellness Group provides a safe and supportive environment, where we can come together to ask questions, share parenting techniques and stories, and discuss timely and relevant family wellness issues.

 

Here's how the group will work:

Our Community will meet and have facilitated discussions led by local Hoboken chiropractor Dr. Laura Brayton, D.C. (www.hobokenchiro.com), who specializes in pediatrics and maternity.

All members of this group will receive a free copy of Pathways to Family Wellness magazine, which will serve as the springboard for our discussions. Pathways is a nonprofit, educational, wellness program, which is free to parents. Their non-profit mission is to support you and your family’s quest for wellness. They offer a full spectrum of articles related to family and personal growth.

Hard copies of the Pathways Magazine are available at Dr. Brayton's office (50 Harrison Street, Suite 316, Hoboken, NJ 07030) and upon request, can be mailed directly to your home.

Because we know you're super busy, we will also distribute a condensed electronic version of the magazine, which contains a summary of the articles, and talking points that will serve as the basis for our discussion.

** Whether you have had the opportunity to read the materials or not, ALL are welcome and encouraged to attend the Community Discussions.

Topics will be largely determined by the Group, but will include: 

* Birth and pregnancy

* Compassionate parenting 

* The science of wellness, nutrition - including gluten-free, whole foods and seasonal recipes

* Child development & educational reform 

* Coping with children's allergies and food sensitivities 

* Helping your child deal with change 

* The vaccination controversy 

* Consciousness and the MotherBaby bond

* Psychiatric drugs and your children 

* Tending the garden of your child's mind 

* Creating healthy babies

* Breast feeding and your kids 

* Midwifery v. hospital births 

* Tips on starting a community garden

We believe stepping onto our personal pathway to wellness is a consciousness-raising act with the power to regenerate and transform ourselves, our families, our communities and our world.

We look forward to building this Community with you.
results.name: Holistic Parents of Hudson County

results.description:
These are not your typical software engineering events.

This is an exciting time for our human computer civilization and NYSE is a community organization dedicated to creating events for software engineers on emerging technologies and topics that have never been attempted before.

Events focus in on topics like Machine Learning, Robotics, Nanotechnology, Arduino, 3D Printing, Synthetic Biology, Artificial Intelligence, Computer History, Computer Vision, Big Data, Augmented Reality (AR), Wearable Devices, Software to Create Art, and Interstellar Space Travel all from a software engineers perspective.

NYSE creates events only possible in NYC and the New York region with experts from all walks of life as possible speakers in panels and even debates between different languages, IDE's, technologies, techniques, marketing strategies and more.

Coding ability is encouraged but not required to attend our events.

Events on emerging technologies may also touch on app development, OO, cloud, mobile, HTML5, Hadoop, Python, Eclipse, JavaScript, JAVA, HBASE, MapReduce, Erlang, jQuery, Swift, MongoDB, NoSQL, PHP, Agile, Ruby on Rails (RoR), Frameworks, Node.JS, Angular.JS, IDEs, animation, design, Twisted, Android, iPhone, iOS, Business Intelligence, and UI/UX.

NYSE offers unbelievable social networking opportunities with people from all backgrounds and philosophies.  We encourage everyone to join who has a love for new technologies, software engineering, and the opportunity to network with people building the future.

Join BASE, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.

Code The Future.

Code of Conduct:

Our goal is to create an inclusive group. While we encourage you to be passionate and opinionated about code, we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. Racist, sexist, agist, and other derogatory language or innuendo will not be tolerated.

Keep discussion on topic and focused on Sass and Compass. Promoting products, services, or anything unrelated to Sass and Compass will be considered spam. Keep channels clean for people who need help or want to share thing about Sass and Compass.

If you have any questions or concerns please reach out to an organizer. You can reach the group at gothamsass[at]gmail.com.

results.description:
Ultimate LOVE and Passion (ULP for short) is a community of like-minded individuals creating friendships and relationships that stand the test of time. Using principles from top authors, trainers and coaches we can ALL learn to have fun, playful, passionate relationships with the right person.

Have you tried all those "other" dating sites?

Do your friends try to set you up on blind dates?

Have you been in relationships where you just don't have that "spark" everyone talks about?

Are you on a journey of self growth but don't know where to find others for support?

If you answered "YES" to any of these questions ULP could be the perfect fit for you!

Who should join ULP?

- Someone that is NOT in a current relationship (SINGLE).

- Someone involved in personal/professional growth and development.

- Someone who is seeking an ideal and committed relationship/friendship.

- Someone who wants to learn how to have an ideal relationship.

- Someone who likes to have fun, socialize and meet new people.

When applying for membership please complete the following:

1. All of the required profile questions to the best of your ability.

2. Upload a CURRENT picture of yourself (preferably a headshot).

If your profile is not complete we will contact you for further information and may deny your membership request.

Ultimate LOVE and Passion is where singles who set a higher standard connect!

results.description:
Traders! Precision Trading Labs (PTL) is rebooting the NYC/Tri-State TradeStation (TS) Users Group. We aim to give TS users a local place as well as an online community to meet and discuss all-things-TradeStation. Some of us are experienced users and very well-versed in TS's core and advanced features, but don't code EasyLanguage (EL). Others are EL wizards and and write their own strategies and functions. Still others are new to the platform, either experienced traders moving to TS, as well as rookie traders new to everything.

The principals of PTL are fulltime traders and use TS for all four asset classes. We are very well versed in the platform but don't code, except to lightly personalize code someone else has written.

Please join us and share your questions, tips, experiences, and ideas. Novices come and hear from experienced users. TS is great, but there's definitely a learning curve. All are welcome. And if besides discussing the platform we talk a little trading, all the better!

We've got a wall monitor to which we attach a laptop via HDMI, so if you wish to demonstrate something, it can be done if you bring either your own laptop, or workspaces and EL files on a flashdrive.

Come join us!!!

ABOUT THE ORGANIZER

I'm Mitch Firestone, a full-time trader here in NYC. I live in Manhattan (Chelsea) and work out of a traderoom in Midtown West. I have stepped up to become the new organizer of the NYC/Tri-State TradeStation Users Group.

I've been trading for a living for 4+ years, supporting myself and family 100% through trading: (1) day- and swing-trading equities (2) options and (3) intraday futures. Along with fellow trader and co-organizer Ryan Nocera, I'm a co-founder of Precision Trading Labs (http://www.precisiontradinglabs.com/) and co-organizer of a separate trading-focused meetup, NYC Technical Trader Talks (http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Technical-Trader-...) and a newly-formed options-focused group, NYC Options Traders (http://www.meetup.com/nyc-options-traders/). Both of these also meet here at the PTL traderoom.

After my family and friends, trading is my passion, along with good jazz, jam bands, baseball & a nice single malt.
results.name: NYC (Tri-State) TradeStation Users Group

results.description: There's nothing more frustrating than stress from the job. I run a popular blog and a internet radio show that deals specifically with workplace related matters.  There's nothing more frustrating than an unsatisfying work culture and being in the city, quite a few work places are like that.  I have personally experienced bullies, unscrupulous co-workers, pay inequity, and discrimination.  But what I also realized was that getting help for job-related trouble is much harder than it needs to be. If you're having drama on the job and need someone to talk to, you should join my group. I will provide an assessment of your situation and provide advice and advocacy for all your job and workplace concerns.
