results.description:
I see so many great food-related festivals and events going on in NYC throughout the year, but I believe I probably miss out on even more that I never hear about! So I thought it would be fun to put together a group to keep each other informed of events and hang out at them. For example, I just realized that I missed the Lobster Rumble a few weeks ago, but will be 100% attending the upcoming Bacon Bash and Cheesemonger Invitational! (as of 6/23/12)

Please feel free to schedule events, and/or send me your event ideas and I will try to organize them all. Please note the costs of each event, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.

Update (Fall 2012): I wont' be updating this group until the spring when more events come around and more people are up for coming out to them. In the meantime, I highly encourage you to follow Dave Cook's Eating In Translation Blog, Street Fairs category: http://www.eatingintranslation.com/street_fairs/
results.name: NYC Food Festivals and Events Group

results.description:
About Us

Sometimes you just want to enjoy a good meal and watch a movie. And then talk the hell out of it afterwards. I want to meet anyone who is interested in catching a flick either during the week or over the weekend and want to talk about it over some food.  And don't worry, you don't have to prepay me or anyone else for tickets or to save a spot or answer a million questions to get in the group.  There's enough stress in the world, why add to it?  We're a group of movie-lovers who just want to hang and catch a flick with other laid-back and fun people. There won't be any specific genre we'll be sticking to, just any new, exciting, interesting, domestic and foreign, creative, hyped, talked-about or winning films!

Movie Tickets and Meeting Up

Buy your own ticket. I will post a link to purchase the tickets as soon as they are available if you want to purchase them in advance. <br> <br> Exact Times and Location Will Be Confirmed Each Tuesday Night/Wednesday Morning. All theaters confirm movie times by Tuesday evenings. So, EXACT movie times will be posted Tuesday night or Wednesday. So please wait for the updates before asking questions on the conversation board.  All listed movie times before Tuesday are estimated times for when we may see the movie. This will be confirmed to an exact showtime on Tuesday night/Wednesday. <br> <br> The listed time is the movie time, not the meeting up time - the meetup time is usually an hour earlier so check the summary box for details. Dinner or brunch usually follows the movie. Check the summary box for details on location which will be confirmed and updated a few days before the meetup. <br> <br> Meetups are almost always in Manhattan with occasional exceptions on the weekends to downtown Brooklyn. <br> <br> Confirm theater locations before heading out.  Also note, exact meetup locations within the theater will be posted. Once there, if you do not think you see anyone don't worry, we will find you. We hold up signs, walk around, call out for members and post on the conversation board.  Unless you are plugging your ears and closing your eyes, there is no reason you won't be able to find us unless you get there much later than the meet up time and don't let us know about it.  After all, how the heck are we suppose to find you if you make it a point to not be there on time and then not let us know about it.  Anyway, we try very hard not to leave a member behind. <br> <br> If you are running late - please post it on the conversation board and we will save you a seat. <br> Dinner

Part of the moving-going experience is the discussion afterwards, made especially better with good food and drinks!  NYC has so much to offer in terms of food so we will try to find tasty and unique restaurants to try - it's like two meetups in one~!

So, what are you waiting for?  Come and have fun with us~!
results.name: Dinner and a Movie NYC

results.description:
Meet other people interested in Zen Meditation. Zen is not a path of devotion, nor opposed to any faith--just sitting in silence with others and watching the breath. Our initial goal is to learn to live in the moment by experiencing a deepening of our concentration over time. Any person who would like to experience the beauty, peace and connectedness of just sitting in silence with other people is encouraged to come and sit with us. After you come for the first time, there is no need to RSVP to Meetup.  Once you know where we are, all you have to do is show up.

The extent of commitment is personal to each individual. The first time you attend a sit, you are encouraged to arrive a few minutes early if that's possible. Please wear loose, comfortable clothing and leave your shoes outside of the entrance door to the zendo

Most Cold Mountain Sangha  sits are  based in Rutgers University on the Livingston campus in Piscataway  in Lucy Stone Hall, Rm B-103, on Mondays and Fridays (beginner nights), Wednesdays (Advanced) and every other Saturday morning.    Please go to coldmountainzen.org for the most current schedule of sits and locations and directions.  There will be no sit in any location during sesshin (meditation retreat) week beginning Monay, May 22.  Sits will resume on the regular schedule on Wednesday, June 1.    

We have a wonderful teacher who has been practicing Zen for about 40 years and if you would like to learn more about him and our sangha, please visit coldmountainzen.org.  You are welcome to attend any sit at any of our locations.

For questions concerning any of our sits at any location you may call 908-403-1851 between 5:30 and 7 pm on any sit evening. It's not necessary to rsvp.  Just check the schedule on the website and arrive.   If for some reason a sit is cancelled, you will receive an email.
results.name: Monday and Wednesday Beginner  Nights in Lucy Stone Hall

results.description:
Brooklyn Easy Riders Club (BkER) is an American Motorcycle Association chartered Motorcycle Riding Club that meets irregularly, consisting of all levels of experience, equipment, race, gender and/or species.

Are you an alien? - you're welcome here;
A newbie who just bought a bike? - come on over;
A Vespa owner who wants to do long distance riding - longer than five city blocks? - we welcome you;
A proud HOG owner? - come join us;
Sportster rider? - we love'em;
V-star, boulevard, Boneville, gtr, monster, vr? - we don't discriminate.

All we want to do is have fun, share the ride and enjoy life. We'll teach you, we'll trim you, we'll help you, we'll ride with you. Sunday's the best, Saturday we'll do our best.

Safety first! is our motto. And we don't leave any men ﻿behind - or women for that matter.

"...Give me your tired, your poor
Your huddled masses
Yearning to breathe free..."
results.name: The Brooklyn Easy Riders' Club (Bk.E.R)

results.description:
GOTHAM ROCK CHOIR (GRC) is NYC's first and only community choir devoted to Pop, Rock and Soul music.

Every Tuesday night from 7-9 PM, members of GRC gather to rehearse classic and contemporary tunes by artists such as Queen, Bon Jovi, Black Eyed Peas, Jackie Wilson, The Beatles and many more--all in four-part harmony. It's like "Glee" for adults!

Founded in 2009 to provide an alternative to traditional choirs and to give choral singing a much-needed sense of "cool,"  GRC provides a safe and supportive environment for singers of all experience levels, from professional performers to karaoke fans to avid shower singers.

GRC produces several performance events a year, including member cabaret evenings and full choir concerts. Some of the venues we've played: The Knitting Factory, off-Broadway's Players Theatre, Times Square Arts Center, The Duplex Cabaret Theatre, The Triad, and Medicine Show Theatre.

We're currently looking for more singers to join the choir this summer. Music-reading ability or previous choral experience not required. All you need to have is a good ear for music and a passion for singing. We have a special need at the moment for Tenors and Basses, but all are encouraged. Adults only, please.

Please note that there is a nominal Member Fee to join GRC. It comes out to roughly $7-8 per rehearsal and is used to defray expenses such as rehearsal and performance space rental, sheet music, etc.

More info: www.GothamRockChoir.com
results.name: Gotham Rock Choir: NYC's Pop, Rock & Soul Choir

Calling all women in product…

  • Are you a woman who works in a product organization and is excited about developing, managing, marketing, or selling excellent products?
  • Do you find yourself dreaming of ways to make your product better…or ways that your product could make the world better…or both?
  • Do you want to connect with other women and talk about excellence in product development – be it how to generate great ideas or what to do with them?

If your answer is a resounding “Yes!” then join us on this journey to imagine the value our products can have and the value we can bring to our companies (and the world) through product excellence. We’ll look at all forms of innovation and excellence in product development –creativity, structure, research, ideation, process, collaboration, disruption, social entrepreneurship, intrapreneurship, etc.

Let’s use MeetUp to network, have great discussions, be inspired by industry experts, and connect with practitioners who can relate to our day-to-day challenges and aspirations.

results.description:
Who is this meetup group for? Will I fit in?

If you love to travel and like to experience new and exciting things, this is the meetup group for you.

  • Are you spontaneous and always waiting to the last minute to decide to “getaway”?
  • Are you a planner and like to prepare for a trip a minimum of a year in advance?
  • Do you consider vacation only to be a Rest & Relaxation experience?
  • When you vacation is partying and mingling with singles a necessity?

If you answered "yes" to any of the above questions this is the group for you! I fit in all of the above mentioned categories, I plan trips one year in advance but also decide to get outta town at the last minute, especially when one of those online travel deals are just the right price. I love to party and hang out with the locals but also like relaxing on the balcony of my hotel room enjoying the view. This group is for both men and women all of ages who enjoy traveling but often find themselves traveling alone and sometimes want a friend to accompany them (traveling with partners is important for safety and besides whose gonna take that awesome pic of you standing next to JLO @ the airport?). We will first have several local meetups getting to know each other and enjoying all the fun things the City has to offer, then eventually begin planning our awesome vacations. If you have an idea for trip, feel free to email me or post the trip on the meetup page as a suggestion.

This group started out with a casual breakfast networking group for a number of industries and individuals but has now expanded to lunches and happy hours each month. Breakfast consists of bagels and spreads (please BYO beverage),  and Happy Hours are cash bars unless we get a sponsor. Every attendee will have a few minutes to speak to the group and provide a brief description of him/herself. There will also be some time after the meeting for extended networking, if you so chose. Seats are limited to 45, so please RSVP for approval. Our events take place in midtown NYC. 

We charge $25.00 for all meetings unless you become a member at $500/year. (Your first meeting is free if you just want to check it out). Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 online payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA)

results.description:
This meetup is specifically designed for all levels of players to reach the next level in their tennis career. I am an intermediate/advanced player who has played for several years at courts all around the city. I enjoy playing with all types of players and learning from their play, I've also done a bit of research and picked up several different workouts and drills from varying sources such as books, tennis magazines, internet, tennis channel, etc... Amongst other things I am a certified personal trainer having worked at Equinox in past. We will be conducting meetups 2-3 times a week which are geared to improve your cardio, footwork, groundstrokes, volleys, overheads, serves, returns, lobs, and overall court awareness.  Essentially a professional tennis workout regime. We will also rally and members are welcome to stay for a long as they want and do some general hitting and possibly matches.

This meetup is unlike other tennis meetups in that it will be geared towards the serious tennis enthusiast who wants to work hard, improve, meet other like minded professional and courteous people, and have a great time.

Another aspect of this meetup is that we will introduce our members either new to New York or native, to courts where you can play for  2+ hours without needing a permit and with lights on till midnight. All the busier courts require a $200/year permit and lights on some courts require $50-$60/hour.

Based on all these aspects we will selective in choosing our members and membership is contingent to approval by the organizer and we reserve the right to cancel your membership if you are disruptive to the class. We are looking for hard working, fun loving, courteous people who really want to get better.

With all this said we are open to members contributing drills and workouts to the program.

Welcome to the Brooklyn Tennis Factory!!
results.name: Brooklyn Tennis Factory

results.description:
Developers create solutions to problems in complex systems. "Health" involves an unbelievably complex system (the body), tangled up with an unfathomably real abstraction (the mind) and wrapped in a morass of business, government, and good intentions so labyrinthine in nature that it would make Kafka cry. If you love exploring elegant fixes to problems of mind-shattering difficulty in a collaborative environment then Health Devs is the group for you.

 

Things health devs do:

* Show off hacks we've built that transform health and healthcare

* Share information on the nuts and bolts of developing healthcare technologies -- everything from hacking healthcare's many non-standard "standards" to building great UI for doctors to integrating with EHRs

* Talk about the core problems of plaguing healthcare, and how to hack them
results.name: Health Devs NYC

results.description:
A meetup for Painfully Shy women (those who have social anxiety disorder). If social anxiety has crippled your life, come join us.

Don't worry if you are painfully shy to the point where you barely talk. I understand! Step by step you will become more comfortable in social settings.

Wallflower Power is where Social Anxiety has a voice and it can be social and fun! My goal is to make this group resourceful and meaningful to you.

Keep in mind that it is okay to be soft spoken or introverted. The disorder is when you are sooo socially anxious that you can't LIVE your life and these are the people we want to help!  I am YOU!

So come join me. I know social anxiety makes social situations very difficult so we will meet up monthly instead of weekly.

Subscribe to our newsletter


(Disclaimer: Any information on therapies/treatments/supplements/herbs/medications/etc. that you read about on this site or any affiliated Wallflower-Power site, social media page, etc. is not intended nor implied to be a substitute for professional medical advice. You should always consult your healthcare provider to determine the appropriateness of the information for your own situation or if you have any questions regarding a medical condition or treatment plan. When it comes to anything of this nature, I am simply creating experiences, sharing my experience or sharing information that I find.)

results.description:
We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. All levels are welcome. Please join us Fridays

Typical evening schedule:

20 Minutes Seated Meditation

10 Min Walking Meditation

10 Min Reading

30 Min Sharing Circle

Tea And Snacks till closing

 

No fee, donations welcome

 

Mission Statement:

New York Wake Up is a group of young meditation practitioners who get together to create a joyful space of refuge for young adults. We are inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. We do the fun things that New York city dwellers do, but actively maintain the best elements of our culture: inclusiveness, healthy consumption, hope, joy, great energy, activism, and community. By being wonderfully together we create support for each other. We find we are not alone with the suffering of our generation. We seek out our true selves amid the dynamics of our new relationships, new jobs, struggling minds, dynamic bodies, busy cities and big life changes. We share our success in practicing mindfulness and finding happiness. We practice with our local Sanghas, at practice centers, and with the teachings, so as to nurture our hearts and minds and create real hope for our generation and our future
results.name: Wake Up New York - Meditation and Mindfulness

results.description:
Hello! My name is Laura Madrigano and I love to use journaling and self-care as my healing tools that keep me connected to my intuition and the messages from my soul. I literally need to self-care or I cant function. So much so, that I made a career out of it. I am a Board Certified Spiritual Life + Business Coach and I help people heal from the past so that they can live a life they LOVE.  My coaching practice is located in Fanwood NJ and these meetups take place there...It is a lovely, professional, serene environment! (See pictures below!)

Journaling can be used as a wonderful tool to help you deepen your self-care, heal old wounds, and keep you connected to your inner souls messages! 

I offer meetups along with self-care classes and workshops, vision board workshops, a spiritual book club,  guided journaling classes,  group coaching sessions, Intuitive Coaching Sessions, and Angel Card Readings. (view my website here : www.LauraMadrigano.com)

If you are interested in learning how to use journaling as a Spiritual Listening Tool, then this group is for you! I cannot wait to meet you! 

xoxo Laura Madrigano

results.description: New York is at the hub of the next wave of startups and venture funding. While many meetup groups showcase particular startup projects or focus on narrow issues, this group is intended to explore at a higher level the full range of business and legal issues that confront startup companies. These include founder relationships, intellectual property matters, funder expectations, marketing, and developing a user base. This group will help make your startup stronger from the very beginning. Meetups will generally be held every other Monday. Panelists will be drawn from successful and well-known New York startups and venture capital funds, as well as highly experienced lawyers from the national law firm Foley & Lardner.  These panelists will share the lessons they have learned from their experiences in the New York startup scene, both in the presentations and in the informal networking before and after each event.

Palisades tech breakfast gives a nod to the Palisade Cliffs just above the Hudson, from Tenafly to Weehawken. Though we'd welcome anyone with a 201 area code, really.

 

Using the land of diners for our turf, and the skyline as our backdrop, lets grab some food (you have to pay for your own, sorry), grab a seat, and talk tech. There's no particular focus other than meeting some new people and having some interesting conversations.

 

Credit goes to James Dennis and Sean O'Connor for starting the first "tech breakfast" in DUMBO: http://www.meetup.com/DUMBO-Tech-Breakfast/. An awesome biweekly event we highly suggest if you can make it across 2 rivers.

results.description:
"TrainDeep - Exercise Alchemy™" is a holistic fitness system that shows you how to use exercise as a tool for empowerment.  It harnesses the wisdom of the your to create the life you were born to live.

This is exercise as a path to self-mastery and realization, not a 6 pack.


What are the core principles of TrainDeep?

Primal Nature- humanity and nature are a unified singular whole.

  1. Warrior Spirit- it takes courage to grow up and become the person you were born to be.
  2. Tribe- belonging to and serving a community that you believe in is the highest honor.
  3. Play- fun, imagination, and creativity spark real learning and growth.

Transformation- the source of all power lies deep with.  Use alchemy to turn suffering into purpose.

  1. Body-Mind- the body and mind are 2 sides of the same coin. Shape it into a powerful force of nature.
  2. Awareness- energy follows focus; what you think, do, and believe becomes your reality.
  3. Direct Experience- no idea is a substitute for personal experience.

Ultimate Life- how you live is your message to the world.

  1. Movement- self-mastery is the primary goal of exercise.
  2. Stillness- rest, relaxation, and meditation are the foundation of all progress.
  3. Nourishment- your relationship to food and media is vital.


What kind of workout is it?

The kind that works your body, mind, and soul into a symphony of pure energy, love, laughter, and power  :-)

Based on my 14 years experience as a personal trainer, we'll be playing games, running around, and exploring movement and goal setting in a small, intimate environment.  We'll be doing all kinds of body weight exercises, including calisthenics for conditioning, partner exercises, and yoga, Tai Chi, and meditation for a cool down.

Most importantly, it will be a fun workout.

Will it be a hard workout?

Yes and no and maybe so.  The goal is not to make you throw up, the goal is to have fun, get your heart rate up, and maybe learn some stuff and meet some cool people.  You can push as hard as you want to, there will be plenty of opportunities to test your conditioning, but you will be encouraged to honor your limitations and not take anything too seriously.

Fitness should be fun, communal, and meaningful above all else, not throw-up-tastic.

What should I expect to experience?

  • expect to meet some cool people and to support each other as a team.
  • expect to have fun and try a bunch of physical games.
  • expect to get a little dirty. expect to be surprised when you enjoy the feeling.
    expect to leave camp with a new relationship to exercise and your body.
  • expect to leave each workout with some small follow up homework.
  • expect to get strong, learn new movement skills, and to leave with a smile on your face.
  • expect the unexpected. Ninja boobies. Huzzah!

What kind of results will I get?

 Your family will love you more, you'll become a sex icon, and all of your bank accounts will instantly quadruple.  But seriously, you'll deepen your connection to your body and have greater self-mastery over your path, if you do the work.

What do you mean by work? I thought you said this would be fun?

We will work hard at having fun!  Each workout you will be challenged physically, mentally, and spiritually, and be given follow up homework based on your specific goals, needs, and performance level. You will get out of it what you put into it; no more, no less.

Who shouldn't come?

If you are looking to practice your suffering and throw up after the workout, this is definitely not for you.

If your open-minded adventurer who likes having fun while moving around, and aren't afraid of a tiny ity bit of intimacy, this is definitely for you!

What if I have an minor injury? What if I am out of shape?

All fitness levels are welcome, but you are ultimately responsible for honoring your own boundaries.  We are all wounded in one way or another!  Most of the time, you can work around your injury safely if you are humble and present.  Please email me at ninja@traindeep.com if you have a major injury.
results.name: TrainDeep©

results.description:
The Center is a lighthouse- a beacon of peace, love, strength, and stability serving people from all walks of life who represent all cultures and traditions. It is a place of lifelong learning, guided by the truth of universal principles. A safe and serene oasis, the Center inspires individuals to look inward, and forward- to explore their true nature, innate values, and higher purpose.

The Meditation Center and Gallery is coordinated and run by the Brahma Kumaris World Spiritual Organization. We recognise the intrinsic worth and goodness of every human being and help people rediscover these attributes through a process of lifelong learning.

A worldwide family of individuals, we are committed to spiritual growth and personal transformation, believing them essential in creating a peacful and just world.

We offer a host of courses, workshops and seminars (in English and Spanish):

    The Foundation Course in Meditation- gives a clear understanding of the relationship between the spirit and matter, mind and body, and the interplay between soul, God, and our material world. On the basis of this understanding, one is able to practice meditation.

    Positive Thinking- provides techniques on how to direct and use the mind in a positive and focused way.

    Stress-free Living- offers concepts and techniques to understand, manage and prevent stress.

    Secrets of Self-Esteem- reveals how to build and sustain self-esteem and self-worth.

All courses and programs are offered free of charge, as community service. The organization is funded by voluntary contributions.

Subscribe to our monthly email with our Calendar of Events and Special Events with guest speakers.


We can be contacted at eventsmcgny@gmail.com or at 212-564-4335
results.name: Meditation Center and Gallery

results.description:
Welcome to Amazon Sellers Unite NYC (ASUNYC)

Whether you’re new to Amazon or a seasoned seller, we welcome all in learning how to efficiently build, sell and combat for the sought after Buy Box.

Who we are:

We are like-minded entrepreneurs looking to learn and grow with each other. We develop and share strategies on building trusted relationships, growing and extending your business externally through Amazon, and ways to shove competition aside and dominate the market. We are all looking to become successful in the E-commerce world, so why not learn and succeed together?

What to expect:

We have members that extend from newbie sellers to E-commerce experts and instructors. We host events and seminars all over New York City where we meet, discuss and listen to lectures of both the common and unique strategies to selling at a highly competitive marketplace.

We have speakers who have built international, multimillion-dollar brands by selling on Amazon first. They will share the lessons they have learned and valuable strategies on clawing to the top of the Amazon ladder.

We have developers of the latest tools and systems to assist entrepreneurs on bettering their systems and learn how to make the most out of their selling platforms.

This is not: 


…a “toss your business card in a bowl, now meet and sell your product to everyone.” We are here to learn, teach, and share. We want everyone to meet and say to each other, “I can help you succeed.”

Most Importantly:

Have fun. Meet others just like you. And share your business with pride.

It’s absolutely FREE to join our Group, and we hope to see you at our next Meetup!
results.name: Amazon Sellers Unite NYC

results.description: Steel Horse Riding Group is a group for Riders who enjoy more than your typical Bikini Bike Wash and Motorcycle Festivals.  We are dedicated riders who enjoy RIDING.  Whether its a short ride for a quick bite, or a multi-day excursion, we do it for the love of riding and sharing the experience with each other in a safe and organized setting.  Our rides are well planned and designed for all riders to enjoy.  Some rides are simple, relaxing rides while others can be more "advanced" with longer distances, and challenging roads.

results.description:
Calling all data do-gooders: come rub elbows and throw high fives with DataKind’s community of top data scientists and social sector leaders working to tackle the world’s toughest problems with data science.

Are you a data scientist by day hankering to use your data prowess to find new insights, grapple with the most pressing social issues of our time and rub elbows with inspiring mission-driven organizations?

Join us for one of our Project Accelerator Nights and in just a few hours you’ll have the chance to make a difference where we gather some of the city’s best  mission-driven organizations with their questions about how to leverage data in the service of their cause.

Do you work for an organization doing good in the world? Are you struggling with how to use data to further your cause? Want to get on-the-spot counsel and ideas from people who work with data for a living?

Bring your questions about how to use ‘big data’ and new sources of information to this gathering of top-notch data scientists and get on-the-spot advice for your organization.

Plus, hear inspiring presentations on learnings from our DataCorps and DataDive work with great organizations like Grameen Foundation, DC Action for Children, NYC Parks Department and The World Bank. All that and, we provide the beer!

Want to learn more? Check out our website to see how you can volunteer your data skills for good or how your organization can leverage data science for greater impact: http://www.datakind.org

Will we see you at our next get-together?
results.name: DataKind NYC

results.description:
We are the Soccer Mongrels and CIVILITY is our watchword.

The soccer mongrels started out from Harlem Indoor Soccer. Please check out our old blogspot @ harlemindoorsoccer.blogspot.com to learn more about our history.

Uptown soccer Meetup group is an extension of Harlem indoor soccer and our aim is to get individuals to play leisure pickup football/ soccer in a friendly atmosphere.

Who should join? Intermediate and advanced players are welcomed to join. Please join uptown soccer group and you will be invited to our meetup as soon as they are scheduled.

Rules: Games are played 4 aside with 3 outfield players and a keeper. Participants will be expected to take turns in goal during the course of a session.

- Games are 8mins each a session. Winning team stays on after scoring 2 goals, or losing team stays on if game is tied and there are no new new teams on the sideline.

- Absolutely no slide tackling.

- We play on a turf field. Please, No cleats allowed.

- Balls and Pinnies will be provided.

Fee: Please pay the fee online via paypal. Some of the proceeds go to support soccer development in the neighborhood.

www.fcharlemlions.org.
results.name: Uptown Soccer

There are lots of volunteering opportunities around the city but it isn't always the easiest thing to become involved. This meetup is in its early stages, so any and all help is appreciated! If you know of any organizations that are looking for volunteers, tell us about them or tell them about us. And if you know anyone who is looking to volunteer, please feel free to lead him/her in our direction. More importantly, if you ever have any suggestions as to how we can make the group better, be sure to let us know by contacting us. Thanks - we're excited to volunteer with you!

 

Discover why some of the richest people in the world are not millionaires, they are volunteers. Never doubt that a small group of committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has. - Margaret Mead

About the book:  "Julia Cameron again draws from her extensive artistic and teaching experience to steer readers toward ever widening creative horizons.  This extraordinary book of learning through doing features inspiring teachings on the creative process and more than one hundred imaginative, involving, and energizing tasks.  Each task engages readers in "inner play," leading to authentic growth, renewal, and healing. "

We get together to play soccer every Saturday Night on JJ walker field in the West Village JJ Walker Field Clarkson St - between Hudson & Varick Sts New York, NY 10014 Rules - Bring a light jersey and a dark jersey so we can tell the lights from the darks. I cannot stress enough that this game is supposed to be a friendly, social kickabout. No hard tackles, no lunging into 50/50 balls, no selfish dribbling. If you cannot manage to play at a level that is inclusive of everyone on the pitch, you will be uninvited from the game. There are more than enough competitive leagues and pick-ups to satisfy your aggressive tendencies. Also, too many of you that have already played have not had the courtesy to pay. Please don't come again without cash in hand. If you haven't joined us yet, please confirm that you want to remain on the roster. Please make every effort to come before 9PM. That makes it easier for me to get the softball guys off the field.

$5/night

Our season is guaranteed through August. After that, the field is scheduled to be closed for resurfacing. If they don't start the work, we'll play until they do.

results.description:
Unigroup is the oldest and largest Unix User's Group (Unix/Linux/BSD) serving the Greater New York City Regional Area since the early 1980s. Unigroup has been serving the NYC Unix/BSD/Linux/AIX/Solaris/... Community for over 30 years! Unigroup was the first Technical Group in NYC to regularly cover topics related to Linux and Linux Distributions.

Unigroup is a 501c3 not-for-profit, vendor and platform neutral, member funded, volunteer organization. Unigroup holds regular and special event meetings throughout the year on technical topics relating to the Unix/Linux/BSD Operating Systems and the Unix/Linux/BSD User Community. Most Unigroup meetings are open to the public!

Unigroup presentations cover topics relating to both Unix and Unix-like Operating Systems (Unix/Linux/BSD/AIX/Solaris), as well as other related technologies including: Computers, Communications, Cryptography, Databases, Storage Architecture, Internet, Networking, Security, Programming Languages, Software Development, Web Development, Systems Administration, DevOps, Data Center, Hardware Acceleration (FPGA/GPU/DSP/ASIC), High Performance Computing/Clusters, Low Latency Computing/Networking, Small Form Factor Computers, Embedded Computing, IoT, IT Technology, Free Software, Open Source and Software Tools.

Unigroup meeting topics span ALL varieties of UNIX, BSD, LINUX, and related Operating Systems, covering both Commercial / Closed Source, and Freely Available / Open Source: projects, products, methods and tools. Our Unix/BSD/Linux technical presentations have covered subject matter relating to the following operating systems and projects: AIX; HP-UX, True64, Ultrix; IRIX; OS/X, A/UX; SCO, OpenServer, UnixWare, OpenUnix, Xenix; Solaris, OpenSolaris, SunOS, UnbreakableLinux; FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, BSD/OS; RedHat, CentOS, Fedora; SuSE, OpenSUSE; Debian, Ubuntu, Knoppix, Raspbian; Caldera, OpenLinux; Plan9; as well as a variety of other distributions.

Spanning its 30+ year history, Unigroup has presented technical meetings covering IT Technology which is of interest to a broad audience of IT Professionals, including: Software and Web Developers, System Administrators, System Engineers, System Architects, Security Administrators, Network Administrators, Database Administrators, Intrastructure Engineers, End-Users and Computer Enthusiasts. Unigroup has historically had a large percentage of Wall-Street/Financial and Banking/Brokerage professionals attending our meetings. Unigroup is known for being one of the most Technical User Groups around NYC, and with 2.5 hours of presentation time available, we are able to explore the meeting subject matter in depth.

Our web site is http://www.unigroup.org/
results.name: Unigroup of New York

results.description:
If....

  • You want to be able to speak to your boss or your peers with confidence and eloquence.
  • You want to be able to give a presentation wherever, to whomever, and whenever and engage your audience.
  • You want to be more articulate and persuasive so that you can lead a group of people.

 

 

Then you should join Nutley Toastmasters!

Nutley Toastmasters is a public speaking club whose mission is to help people overcome their fear of public speaking, develop communication and leadership skills. Open to all. Meet at 7:15pm on lst and 3rd Monday of each month @ Franklin Reformed Church, Hillside Crescent, Nutley, NJ

 

Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.

 

 

Visit our website: http://7487.toastmastersclubs.org/

 

 

Visit our YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/NutleyToastmasters


 

Visit our Facebook FanPage: https://www.facebook.com/NutleyToastmastersClub

 

Come and join us and have some FUN while improving your communications skills!
results.name: Nutley Toastmasters Club

results.description:
This is a group for those working through the emotional aspects of separation and divorce-- to heal, find closure, and enable ourselves to move forward freely after this huge life change.

Divorce is one of the most stressful events that can happen to a human being. In our culture we rush to put a lid on emotions and the natural process that needs to happen to move forward successfully and freely. But you can't skip emotional steps! Just burying the feelings will not help us to learn from our experience, live authentically, or move forward with real freedom.

In this group, we can support each other in our honest expression of emotion--grief, anger, denial, peace--as we work through the emotional fallout of separation.

I am not a counselor, but I am someone who has done a lot of personal growth work and can hold the space to meet and do this work. I like a body-oriented approach too-- the body never lies or tells you stories of how things "should" be, like the mind does! I welcome the involvement of others who do have more experience running process groups.

Inspired by Spiritual Divorce, we can do exercises from the book together,  meet and go-round, or do body-oriented meditation/focusing designed to move through the emotions that exist.

Wherever you are in the process of separation or divorce, you can find support here! Welcome.
results.name: Westchester Separation/Divorce Support Group

John Ruvolo (Excecutive Links) and The Players Club

results.description:
The Women’s Collaborative is a resource and group where you can network, share experiences, offer support and advice to fellow female entrepreneurs and businesswomen. With a focus on information sharing and community building, TWC aims to empower women and enable their advancement in business and leadership roles.

Our goal is to create a network of reciprocity-based groups where sustainable relationships are built and the advancement of women in business and leadership roles is fostered – enabling growth in positions of power and influence in America.

Join this Group and come to the Meet & Greet Happy Hour Events if you're:

  • looking to be part of a network of colleagues who advise and support each other.
  • a budding entrepreneur who has an idea for a business and not sure where to start.
  • contemplating a major career transition but stuck in the fear of taking the leap.
  • looking to make strategic alliances and connections.

Visit our website RESOURCES page for other women-centric groups you might be interested in.

Join our community on Facebook and Twitter and connect with other TWC members on LinkedIn.

TWC currently has Meet Up Groups in: New York City and Santa Barbara/Ventura, California. If you’d like to START TWC AND ORGANIZE A MEET UP GROUP in another area, we’d love to hear from you.

Visit our website www.thewomenscollaborative.com
results.name: The Women's Collaborative-NYC

results.description:
MOMS Club®of Stamford North is a chapter of the International MOMS Club® (MOMS Offering Moms Support®), a nonprofit organization specifically for at-home mothers. We are a support group designed just for you, the at-home mother of today!  You are interested in the world around you, want a variety of activities for you and your children, and are proud of your choice of at-home mothering for your families! We know, because we're at-home mothers, too!

We meet during the day, when at-home mothers most need support! Some of our activities include playgroups, park playdates, visits to local museums, speakers, cultural events, community service projects and a monthly Moms Night Out.

At-home mothers of any age children are welcome! Come join us for friendship and fun!

http://www.momsclubstamfordnorth.com

Requirements for Membership

Members must be in the Roxbury or Northeast Elementary School district, Town of New Canaan or Town of Pound Ridge, NY. Please verify your school district in Stamford Public Schools Street Directory before requesting to join our group. If you do not live in the Roxbury or Northeast school district, Town of New Canaan or Town of Pound Ridge, NY, please contact the International MOMS Club® for information on the other Stamford chapters.

 

Dues:$30 annual membership fee
results.name: MOMS Club Stamford North

results.description: If you want to gain insight while improving your level of fitness, then the "Walking Talking Cure" is for you!   Walk and talk with a psychologist!  Research documents that walking can be as effective as antidepressants and other psychotropic medications in helping to alleviate depression, stress and anxiety for many individuals.  Combined with talking, we create a healthy, safe experience where personal growth can blossom.  Come join me on the path to emotional and physical health!  Weather permitting, we will walk and talk in a supportive, healthy, outdoor environment.  We also have a food issues walking group that addresses eating and weight problems.  Exercise your mind and body as you free your spirit!  You will have fun!  We have individual as well as group walks, in the afternoons and evenings in Tribeca, NYC as well as in Rockaway Park, Queens.  Insurance accepted as payment.
results.name: The Walking Talking Cure

results.description:
Our spiritual evolution approaches, and as we awaken and connect to our higher selves, Bohemian Woman Rising (BWR) will be a knowledge and resource sanctuary for women and men interested in a conscious pursuit at balancing and connecting to their higher selves.

Let’s celebrate our inner and outer beauty through meditation, Reiki healing, learning circles, crafting, ritual, and health and wellness initiatives. The time is now for redirecting our external focus inward!

There are innumerable thought leaders conveying knowledge about spiritual evolution and living your best life. BWR will delve into the practical application of said tenets. Appreciating folks assimilate information differently, we will offer different venues to get at the same basic information on a given topic, i.e., online book readings, internet resources, movies, crafting, ritual, etc.

BWR’s mission is also that of restoring subordinated knowledge around the topics of the sacred divine and women’s intellectual contributions. The loss of this literary canon has been at a great moral and emotional expense to both women and men, resulting in unbalanced experiential lifestyles: as we continue to labor under historically skewed and misrepresentative information about cultural and social roles.
results.name: Bohemian Woman Rising

results.description:
Vision: "To be the leading empowerment and professional development group for Latinas everywhere"

Mission: To provide Latina professionals a community where likeminded women provide development and guidance support through social and professional events. To bring inspiration and teach leadership while having fun and giving back. 

This group is for Latinas in the NYC/NJ area who are interested in professional and personal growth.

Join this group if you are interested in: helping other Latinas be moved, motivated and inspired professionally or personally.

I believe that supporting fellow Latinas in their pursuit of success is essential. Let's talk about higher education, our community, politics, health, negotiating and healthy relationship techniques.
Join us as we talk about all of these issues over coffee, brunch, running, dancing and even shopping all while networking. Honorary Latinas always welcome - we don't discriminate and appreciate your love and passion for the Latino culture and community.

topics.name: Self Realization and Service to Humanity

results.description: What do Ghandi, John Lennon, Jesus Christ, and Bob Marley have in common? They all emphasize love as being the foundation of life. Are they talking intimate love or did romance somehow hijack the true nature of love? Everybody sings about it, talks about it, and writes about it - but what does love really mean and how can it help you live a better life and create a better world? This meetup is a philosophical exploration of the practical side of love - what does it mean to cultivate true love for yourself, other people, and our planet. Love isn't just a fuzzy concept that dating sites talk about. It's the fundamental motive force behind humanity. Every person wants to be loved and do what they love. Every great accomplishment is the product of people doing what they love. Each meetup is a guided discussion around a particular facet of love, be it compassion, service, forgiveness, kindness, following your heart, etc. We will explore how to apply ancient wisdom to modern human living. This group is open to all. Please join us.
results.name: Wisdom of Love

Carissimi italiani del Centro e Nord America,

Questo meet up vuole raggruppare tutti quegli italiani emigrati all’estero, che condividono le idee del MoVimento 5 Stelle (http://www.beppegrillo.it/movimento/), e che sentendosi ancora legati al loro paese di origine, vogliono dare un contributo di idee, partecipando al dibattito e alla vita politica in Italia.


Noi appoggiamo fermamente la cancellazione di tutti i contributi elettorali, la candidatura di persone senza condanne penali (anche se solamente di primo grado), la regola di un massimo di due mandati per ogni candidato e la riduzione del numero dei deputati e dei loro stipendi.

- Promozione obiettivi M5S nella Circoscrizione CNA

- Supporto alla espressione di candidati M5S per la Circoscrizione CNA per le elezioni Camera e Senato in Italia

- Contributo alla elaborazioni di leggi da presentare nel Parlamento Italiano

results.description:
This is the core meetup for The Stamford Innovation Center the entrepreneurial hub of Stamford, CT located in Stamford's iconic Old Town Hall.  www.stamfordicenter.com

Mission

Our vision is to support the growing and diverse group of start-ups that are sprouting up all over Metro NYC and Southwestern CT. Our sole objective is to create an environment where entrepreneurs can tap into the deep Expertise, enthusiastic Talent, proven Service Providers and experienced angel and VC Investors that live and work in our part of the world. We want you to be a part of our community -- your ideas, needs and contributions are an essential element of our plan for success.

Description

Situated in the majestic and newly restored Old Town Hall in downtown Stamford, the Stamford Innovation Center is the ideal office space for young enterprises to grow along with their peers.  We offer coworking, private workspaces, meeting rooms and event spaces, along with mentoring, education and networking to guide startups on their journey from an idea to a viable business.

We are located a short walk from the Stamford Transportation Center providing easy access to New York City (30 minutes to Grand Central via Metro-North) or Boston (3 hours to South Station via Amtrak). For information on how to join our community of Entrepreneurs, Investors, Industry Experts and Mentors, please visit www.stamfordicenter.com .
results.name: Stamford Innovation Center Meetup

results.description:
Group Intro Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0MzOT4I8cl0

We want to foster an environment where individuals can come together to share knowledge and build on the ideas of others. Our motivation to start this group is to incorporate "Design Thinking" into our meetups.

The big thing about design thinking is it allows people to build on the ideas of others. Instead of just having that one thread, you think about it, I come up with an idea, and then somebody from somewhere else says, "Oh that makes me think we should do this and then we could do that." And then you get to a place that you just can't get to in one mind.
-David Kelly, Founder of IDEO

results.description:
This is for those who want to explore the world of film through the purest form. Which would be low-no budget films. Create a Hindi cinema that hasn't been explored before; that is short Hindi film group. Bollywood influenced. If you are a high school student, or a scientist that would love to play a role in a piece of creation that has the power to entertain, make people feel and emote... then lets try to make some cool stories come onto screen.

DANCE meet ups for all those who are looking for a reason to dance, we can dance to Bollywood songs through different styles of dance to put something together. Bring your own creativity into the group, and present your ideas. Showcase it ourselves, maybe organize a show? I don't know! Lets go crazy, because this is the city where everything is accepted. NYC!

Collaboration of MUSIC: If you are a pianist, guitarist, composer, or singer(English/Hindi) we can have a meet and try to make something together. Composers can create music, and musicians can try to execute it through instrument or voice. We can have karaoke sessions to showcase singing talent or practice it yourself. Try to sing your favorite songs of favorite singers. If you play an instrument then practice and perform a song that you like!

Acting, and dancing isn't all that this page is about. If you write stories, then we can shape it into a cinematic script. If you love to capture beautiful footage of people, documenting life, actions, or reactions then you may have a really good eye for shooting a scene. If you are a DJ, or a synthesizer, then you must have a good idea of what music goes with a certain mood/feeling and that could work great as a music director/composer. And if you feel you can put all this together creatively then film direction.

Film comes with a lot more in the package: Lighting, Sound recording on set or in studio, script supervising(making sure that each scene is being shot according to the script or within the limits of the theme so it doesn't sway away), production designer/Art director(looking for the best locations for each scene, setting up the look of the room or location, deciding props that should be used by the actors), if you love to do make up, or design clothes and a lot more. Film is a collaborative medium and the best part about it is that a bunch of people come together to do what they all do best.
results.name: BollyArt: Hindi Films, Dance, and Music

results.description:
'Join survivors of female genital mutilation (FGM) also known as female circumcision.

And supporters against the practice as we discuss FGM in New York and the world.

And, come together to put an end to this practice that mutilates a girl every 16 seconds.

There are currently 140 million mutilated women worldwide, over 300,000 of them are in the United States.'

Founder of 'End Female Genital Mutilation' meetup group.

 

 

We are a small group.

So, we will be concentrating on how to find and publicize solutions to preventing FGM.

If you know of any successes - please email me - or, join this group.

 

Kind regards.

 

Bobbie.

[Organizer.]

 

 

Please also click on Pages to read Pages about Ayaan Hirsi Ali and Warris Dirie and their Foundations.

 

Please note: that while this meetup.com group, 'End Female Genital Mutilation', publicizes these Foundations, and their endeavours, this group is not a part of either of these Foundations.

 

For more information, on the AHA Foundation, please click on:

theahafoundation.org/issues/female-genital-mutilation/

And: theahafoundation.org/about/

And: theahafoundation.org/get-involved/start-a-local-chapter/

 

If you or someone else needs help then you can go to: theahafoundation.org/get-help/

And, Download the AHA Resource Directory.

 

If you know of any other good organisations, that we can publicize and support, please join this group or email me.
results.name: End Female Genital Mutilation

results.description:
We are a group of dedicated road cyclists, with some of us training for organized rides and/or races.

We welcome all newcomers, but we ask that you have a functioning road bike (No folding bikes, cruisers, or other leisure-type bikes) and be able to average at least 13 mph.

 

 

We offer early morning rides in Prospect Park and beyond during the week, as well as longer rides on weekends.

Rides aren’t “led” (please bring your own cue sheet) - they’re just times to meet up with some good folks and ride. Ride distance and pace will vary depending on who shows up.

There will still be plenty of opportunities to stop for coffee/lunch and regroup

Group ride rules and guidelines:

Please follow these!  Otherwise you may be asked not to ride with us.

***We welcome all newcomers, but we ask that you have a functioning road bike (No folding bikes, cruisers, or other leisure-type bikes) and be able to average at least 13 mph***

  • You’re responsible for yourself and your own safety, as well as that of others; always ride smart, ride safe
  • Wear a helmet
  • Ensure that your bicycle is safe and serviceable
  • On rides where we use a cue sheet, please make sure you have a copy of the cue sheet, whether printed or on a GPS device and readily accessible as to orient yourself at anytime
  • No headphones, ear buds, radios or similar audio devices during the ride...it's not safe!
  • Be considerate of slower and faster riders around you; remember that this is a fun ride, NOT a race
  • Be careful, signal, and let others know when you’re slowing or stopping.
  • Avoid sudden sideways movements while riding in a group; be predictable and always hold your line.
results.name: South Brooklyn Velo

results.description: Starting to learn Ruby and Rails? This group is for Ruby, Rails, and programming beginners looking to get together and learn from each other. At this meetup, there won't be an expert walking around, helping you overcome roadblocks by giving you the solution. Instead, this group aims to be a gathering of the 'blind', those of us starting on the journey towards becoming developers, working together to share insights and knowledge. Bring a project you've been working on. Bring a Hacker News article you want to share. Bring a list of reference guides or railscasts that may help your fellow 'blind.' Most importantly, bring a desire to work with your fellow travelers on the path to a programming future. Let's code!
results.name: Ruby Blind

results.description: We are a group of warm-hearted Buddhist practitioners studying Mahayana & Vajrayana Buddhism. We provide newcomers to Buddhism as well as established practitioners an opportunity to study, cultivate, learn practices and meditate. Buddhism provides us with tools to discover the true nature of reality as we analyze and reflect upon our lives to understand the causes and conditions that shape the world around us, discover how to uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns, and learn how to cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind. We study teachings and learn ancient practices that show us how to: * Purify negative karma and cultivate pure positive karma * Remove inner and outer obstacles that block worldly and spiritual goals * Uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns * Meditate and cultivate a stable mind * Train the mind in loving-kindness and compassion * Cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind Our deep explorations of Mahayana and Vajrayana Buddhism through cultivation practices, discussions and meditation are shaped by ongoing teachings of Lama Namnang Mingjo Dorje Rinpoche, a humble but highly cultivated Chinese Vajrayana yogi, as well as various Tibetan Buddhist teachers. Come join a friendly group as we support each other in this essential journey through online communication and face-to-face meetings. We look forward to meeting you! Peace, Michelle, Pailin and Susan
results.name: Transform Your Mind and Life: Buddhist Study & Meditation

Through local meetups, hackathons, and workshops, Legal Hackers spot issues and opportunities where technology can improve and inform the practice of law and where law, legal practice, and policy can adapt to rapidly changing technology.

results.description:
This meetup is for anyone innovating within an established company (big or small). Maybe you are trying to bring Lean Startup or Agile into your development process within a larger organization. Or maybe you are trying to create a skunkworks team within your company to create a new product or service.

Discuss issues, and discover how to inspire the case for change!

Lean Startup and Agile aren't solely for startups. Established companies can have true innovation on both small and large scales. Let's get together and share experiences of what it means to be an Intrapreneur, what we have learned and how we can continue to create and embrace change.

Want to know what it means to be an Intrapreneur, here's a great Forbes article on the topic - http://www.forbes.com/sites/onmarketing/2012/05/21/move-over-entrepreneurs-here-come-the-intrapreneurs/. It states "An intrapreneur is someone who has an entrepreneurial streak in his or her DNA, but chooses to align his or her talents with a large organization in place of creating his or her own."

results.description:
Come and learn to make tasty and healthy Japanese delicacies!

You will learn how easy it is to create tasty Japanese food without going through complicated procedures. Certain key techniques will be demonstrated.

In Japanese cuisine there is more emphasis on freshness and seasonality of the ingredients. The huge variety of seasonal foods results in an appreciation of when the different foods are in season and their suitability for providing satisfaction at the time of year when their quality is at its best. Care is taken to make the prepared foods very digestible. Lightness and transparency through fine simplicity is my favourite part of a Japanese meal.

I choose a specifically practical approach for teaching technique, so you will be pleasantly surprised at how easily fine flavor and visual delight can be achieved at your own home after my cooking class.

The most important thing in my class is that you are having fun while you learn. After cooking is done, you will enjoy the dishes you cooked. The cooking classes are held in the East Village.

The price of each class is around 50 dollars. Please contact at info@tokyotwilight.com for more details. Private, semi private or group classes are also available. Thank you.

My recipes have been published by Oyshee (Rakuten) - you can find them here: http://recipe.rakuten.com/
results.name: Healthy friendly Japanese cooking classes

results.description:
Do you live, work, play or volunteer in the Harlem area? Maybe curious to find out what social and community activities are taking place uptown? The HarlemGo Meetup Group is dedicated to getting together offline to take in some of the social options available in Greater Harlem (East, Central, West), as well as to participate in the various volunteer opportunities in the community.

If you're new in town, new to the city, looking to meet new friends or people, or just curious about the things to do in Harlem, consider joining us! Even if you're not so new - you used to live or work here, come back and visit! This is a fun, diverse, and progressive group. We'll visit bars, restaurants, lounges, art exhibits, museums, parades, have board / card game parties, attend outdoor & sporting events, concerts, nightlife and many cultural events taking place. The subdistricts (villages) of Greater Harlem include Morningside Heights, Manhattanville, Hamilton Heights, Sugar Hill, Spanish Harlem (East Harlem), Striver's Row, Astor's Row, and Central Harlem.
results.name: HarlemGo Meetup Group

results.description:
Philosophy and Our Lives is a NYC meetup that dwells in the tension between individual life, lived for the first and last time, and civilization as a shared creation over generations. Can philosophy be of any value to our being in this world?

We read and discuss the uniqueness of the present moment - the philosophy of our time - through the lens of thinkers such as Nietzsche, Camus, Sartre, Adorno, De Beauvoir, Benjamin, Kant, Kierkegaard, Spinoza, Husserl, Habermas, Levinas, Kafka, Althusser, Buber, Hegel, Foucault, Baudrillard, Zizek, Lyotard, Arendt, Heidegger and others.

Philosophy is a relentless interweaving of the actual and the potential. Anyone who is interested in metaphysical questions such as and now what? is welcome to join and engage in ideas!
results.name: Philosophy and Our Lives

results.description: We're a group of black professionals who enjoy the arts.  We regularly go on outings to the theater, ballet, opera, art galleries and musical performances.  Our group strongly supports black cultural events and hold fundraisers to keep black arts thriving in the United States.

results.description:
SPORTS MARKETING CLASSES

Are you looking to learn more about the sports marketing industry? Introduction to Sports Marketing will teach you about the fastest growing marketing industry; types of jobs; various job titles; how to apply for jobs; how to grow your professional network and how to get an informational interview or internship! We will discuss the many jobs you can have working at a team, a league, a brand, an agency and much more! This class will be instructional with plenty of time for your questions as well.

HERE ARE ALL OF OUR CURRENT CLASS OFFERINGS:

· INTRO TO SPORTS MARKETING (101)

· INTRO TO SPORTS SPONSORSHIP (201)

· A LOOK INSIDE SPORTS MARKETING AGENCIES (201)

· INTRO TO TWITTER  FOR #SPORTSBIZ (101)

· RESUME & COVER LETTERS, INTERVIEWS & EFFECTIVE INFORMATIONAL INTERVIEWS FOR SPORTS BUSINESS  (201)


Classes are limited to 10 students per class. Reservations can be made at meetup.com and once made, there is no waiving of the class registration fee unless a student cancels at least 2 days prior to class day.  Our classes sell out so payment is due if online reservations are made via meetup.com. Thank you.

_____________________________________________________

All classes are taught by former NYU Sports Marketing Adjunct Professor & 20-year sports business industry executive: Jennifer Karpf, Director, National Sports Marketing Network (NSMN) - the sports business industry trade association. Learn more at www.sportsmarketingnetwork.com and www.jenniferkarpf.com.

Classes require advance reservations. Seats are limited. $25 per person. Please RSVP at www.meetup.com for the next class we are teaching.

Follow Jennifer Karpf on Twitter: @JenniferKarpf
Email classes@sportsmarketingnetwork.com for more information.

_____________________________________________________

results.description: A discussion and social group for academics and non academics interested in the scientific study of consciousness. What is consciousness? We all know the immediate experience of what it is to be conscious, but from a scientific perspective what on earth it is!? Is it as Francis Cricks "Astonishing Hypothesis" suggests - a phenomena completely explainable as the result of complex neuronal interactions, or is it a quantum mechanical phenomena ? Perhaps its a self-referential computer program running in the brain, or just an elaborate illusion - or is consciousness actually the ultimate underpinning of all reality... ? So far little consensus has been achieved on which of these wildly diverse approaches (if any) is correct. However, ongoing improvements in brain scanning technologies and developments in artificial intelligence ensure that the field continues to rapidly evolve, so the future promises some exciting developments! The group will provide a forum to review and informally discuss some of these wide ranging theories with video viewings and book reviews and also (hopefully) some in person lectures from local experts (given that NYC academic institutions are a hotbed of neuroscience and the philosophy of mind). We'll also discuss some of the potential implications of a successful scientific theory and what kind of tools it might lead to for enhancing consciousness in the future.
results.name: Astonishing Hypothesis - science of consciousness meetup

results.description:
Rahway River Trout Unlimited is one of the newest New Jersey Trout Unlimited chapters. We are an organization of men and women that strive to protect our cold freshwater fisheries throughout the state. Our members meet once a month, discuss many topics from conservation to fishing. We also go on fishing trips throughout the year, conduct river cleanups, host fly tying events, and partake in many other activities. If you like fishing or just want to give back to the environment then RRTU is for you. So tell a friend, come on out and enjoy yourself, learn a few new things, meet some new fishing buddies, and perhaps even consider joining our Trout Unlimited Chapter - #155.

There are no meetup membership dues. All you need to do is come to a meeting and participate! All are welcome, whether you're an old pro or new to the sport. We do encourage members to join Trout Unlimited to support efforts to improve fish habitat and promote the sport of fly fishing.

results.description:
Calling All Entrepreneurs and people in Small Business.

Are you curious about getting your business to thrive, and with more ease?

This will be the premier business networking and educational group in NY.

Our members are entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and those starting businesses, who want to network and collaborate with others, and also learn tools to grow their businesses.


The Purpose of This Group is for You to:

1. Surround yourself in a positive business community, where you can network, meet other business owners and entrepreneurs, find new customers, strategic alliances/joint ventures, referral sources, investors, and make new friends.

2. Get the insider’s education: learn new skills and tools that will grow your business so you can thrive in any economy.

3. Share resources with other entrepreneurs and small business owners, so no one has to reinvent the wheel. It’s all about working smart, not hard---and leveraging your time and resources.


Your Organizer

My name is Dana Garrison and I’m your Organizer; I am an entrepreneur and small business owner, and I help business owners reach six figures and beyond. I'm also a business speaker and trainer, and speak on topics that help entrepreneurs and small business owners grow their business, their reach, and their profits.

I will also support you in growing your business, meeting new prospects, and creating new alliances with other entrepreneurs and small business owners.

And yes, I will help you love sales and marketing, and find ease and joy in it (and a high close ratio to boot!)


Our Community


Let's build this to be one of the largest business and entrepreneur meet up groups in NY, because the more entrepreneurs and small business owners we have, the larger network you have to grow your business.


The more business owners, entrepreneurs, and innovators you know, the more choices and possibilities you have.

 

The foundation of this group is to support each other in growing, and have fun along the way.


Help Spread the Word

I will market this group, and I would love if you would help spread the word about this group too, and send your business and entrepreneur friends this link: http://www.meetup.com/NY-Entrepreneur-and-Small-Business-MeetUp

 

We all succeed through community, so let’s get together and create win/wins.


Start Networking Now

After you click the join button, please introduce yourself. You can start networking right away!

And please fill out the 2 quick questions so we have a place to meet, and so I know what topics are most important for you, to help you grow your business.

 

Join now, and become part of the inner circle of movers and shakers.

results.description:
Haz amigos, involucrate, devuelve y conectate con tu comunidad!

Quienes somos

    Este grupo es principalmente para Mexicanos o México-Americanos  profesionales, estudiantes, empresarios y todos connacionales que buscan superarse y tiene un auténtico aprecio por la cultura mexicana.

    Se dirige principalmente a adultos que les gusta conocer a otros profesionales y socializar.

    Nuestro objetivo es conocer a otros profesionales que compartan nuestra cultura e idioma, apoyarse mutuamente y crear nuevas amistades!

    El idioma principal para nuestras comunicaciones es el español, aunque muchos de nuestros miembros hablan varios idiomas.

    Meetups se llevarán a cabo en restaurantes, bares, y posiblemente discotecas en el norte de Nueva Jersey y en la ciudad de Nueva York. Otros lugares se considerarán como vaya creciendo el grupo.

La mayoría de nuestros miembros tienen una licenciatura y muchos de ellos están estudiando grados avanzados.  Somos una mezcla diversa de profesionales.

    Invitamos a todo los profesionistas,  estudiantes universitarios y personas que estén por empezar la universidad para que nos apoyemos mutuamente.

    Es esencial que los integrantes puedan cómodamente contribuir y comunicarse con otros profesionales.  Esto nos ayuda a mantener un terreno común en el grupo.

Todos nuestr@s participantes deben:

    Participar y ser profesionales y cortés con los demás.

    Contestar todas las preguntas de perfil (más que "hola" por favor) e incluir una foto clara de sí mismo.

Confirmar Asistencia

    Si invita a un amigo o a su pareja, por favor incluyal@ en su RSVP. Algunos lugares podrían ser más pequeños y más íntimos que otros. Por lo tanto, si 10 de nosotros confirmamos nuestra  asistencia, entonces sólo 10 de nosotros deberíamos asistir ese día. Gracias por su comprensión, esto nos ayudará a planear mejor nuestros eventos.

    Para crear un grupo activo, si falta a tres Meetups a los cuales había confirmado su asistencia sin antes cambiar su RSVP, será expulsado del grupo.

    Preferimos calidad sobre cantidad. Los miembros que no han asistido a por lo menos una reunión en seis o más meses  serán eliminados. No es nada personal o permanente, antiguos miembros son bienvenidos para solicitar reincorporarse en cualquier momento.

Participación/publicidad

    Invitamos a todos nuestros miembros a que participen en nuestros foros.

    Por favor no publique propaganda  ya que esto será eliminado.

Como unirse al grupo

    Solo hace falta apretar el boton de "Join us" que aparece en la pagina nuestra de Meet-up y nos llegara su petición.

Únase a nuestro grupo,  esperamos conocerl@ pronto!

Make friends, get involved, give back and connect with your community!

Who we are

    This group is primarily for Mexican or Mexican-American professionals, students, entrepreneurs and all compatriots seeking to excel and have a true appreciation for  Mexican culture.

    It is primarily aimed at adults who like to network and socialize.

    Our goal is to meet other professionals who share our culture and language, support each other and create new friendships!

    The main language used for our communications is Spanish, although many of our members are multi-lingual.

    Meetups will be held in restaurants, bars, and possibly nightclubs in northern NJ and NYC. Other venues will be considered as the group grows.

Most of our members have a bachelor’s degree and many of them are studying advanced degrees. We are a diverse mix of professionals.

    We invite all the professionals,  university students and people who are starting college to join to support each other.

    It is essential that members are able to contribute and communicate with other professionals. This helps us maintain a common ground in the group.

All our participants must:

    Participate and be professional and courteous to others.

    Answer all profile questions (more than "hello" please) and include a clear photo of yourself.

RSVP

    If you invite a friend or a significant other, please include them in your RSVP. Some venues might be smaller and more intimate than others.  Therefore, if 10 of us RSVP, then only the 10 of us should appear that day. Thanks for your understanding, this will helps us better plan our events.

    To foster an active group, three Meetups "no shows" will lead to your removal from the group.

    We prefer quality over quantity.  Members who have not attended a meetup in six months or more will be removed. It's nothing permanent or personal, former members are welcome to request rejoining at any time.

Group participation/advertisement

    We encourage group participation, so please feel free to post on our forums.

    Please do not post advertisements as these will be deleted.

How to join

    All you need to do is click on the “Join us”button on our Meetup page, and we will receive your request.

Join us, we look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Mexican Professionals NJ/NY

results.description:
Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David

results.description:
Ananda meditation groups are places of spiritual satsang for like-minded souls. Ananda NYC meets regularly for meditation, kirtan and satsang.   No prior meditation experience is required to join or attend.  All are welcome!

The purpose of this group is to help you experience the joy of meditation in a relaxed and supportive setting with sincere like-minded souls interested in meditating, learning, sharing, and connecting. This ancient healing science of meditation will help you reduce tension and feel more relaxed with improved mental clarity and awakened inner vitality. In addition to scientifically proven health benefits of meditation, these techniques can take you even deeper into an expanding connection with your spirit.

If you do not know how to meditate, we can teach you simple yet profound techniques.  If you already meditate we can help you learn how to meditate with more concentration and upliftment for those ready to take the next step on their spiritual journey.  In addition to a meditation, each meeting is unique with a different theme and will usually include: chanting, breath work (pranayama), spiritual reading and discussion, healing prayers... 

Everyone is welcome to join us. No prior experience is required. The group meets several times per month.  We have a fairly large distribution email list outside of MeetUp.  So typically many other members come to the events, but may not be RSVP'd on MeetUp.  We also host many workshops and events, check our website for the most updated schedule.

Our Roots:  Based on the teachings of Paramhansa Yogananda, and founded in 1968 by his direct disciple, Swami Kriyananda, Ananda meditation groups welcome seekers from all backgrounds.  We also offer support to those interested in the path of kriya yoga taught by Parmhansa Yogananda, author of the spiritual classic, Autobiography of a Yogi.

results.description:
.'Membership:
Membership is open to families with young children who live on Roosevelt Island. For safety and privacy reasons, new membership requests are not accepted until meeting with an organizer.

All members are required to host one meetup every three months (ie, once in Jan-Mar, once in Apr-Jun, Jul-Sept and once in Oct-Dec). Failure to meet this requirement will result in removal from the group.

2015 Membership Fee

The 2015 fee is $5 per family . The fee is non-refundable and non-transferable.

The membership fee pays for the Meetup website fees of $240/year. The membership fee does not cover the expenses of playdates. Event hosts may ask members to contribute supplies or a few dollars to cover costs of specific meetups.

Guest Policy
Members are not permitted to bring guests (aside from family members) to meetups unless it is clearly specified by the host. RSVPs should be limited to members and their family.

Advertising and Member Solicitation
Members are requested not to post meetups where they are directly profiting, growing a business, or networking.
Meetups should be limited to events which you are attending. Please do not add meetups solely for the sake of advertising.

Qualifying Meetups

Qualifying meetups mean organized playdates or activities (not open to other families not members of this group), with or without crafts, visits to any attraction, place, museum that your family enjoys.

An invite to the playroom in your building does not qualifies as a required meetup to keep your membership in this Meetup group.

The NYC SharePoint Users Group (NYCSPUG) was founded in March 2006. Our mission from inception has been to share deep SharePoint experience with individuals who are interested in learning, sharing and growing their Microsoft SharePoint knowledge and capabilities. The group’s vision is to provide members with a forum to hear top industry experts present, learn and teach others who are interested in the same technologies as you and are facing the same challenges.
