Founders:

Former Chairperson: Dave Kozma

Chairperson: Nilesh Mehta (NGenious Solutions Inc.)


NGenious Solutions, Inc. is a Microsoft Certified Gold Partner specializing in Information Worker and ISV ⁄ Software Solutions. We believe that Microsoft Office Solutions provide organizations with opportunities to achieve excellent improvements in productivity, especially the SharePoint and Enterprise Project Management Technologies. Our complete range of services, addresses the needs of both technology and business requirements to help organizations leverage leading–edge technologies for business improvement. NGenious Solutions Inc.’s engineers, business analysts and architects are seasoned industry veterans with extensive experience working with enterprise IT systems. Our experts can interact efficiently with remote IT organizations and can act as a seamless extension of headquarters IT management.

The NYC SharePoint User Group Team

We are just as qualified to do this as you are. The quarters? We use them to organize and grow this group, as well as build our website. Why do we do all this? Because we love making people happy, talking to anyone in our city, offering our view points, giving our outside opinion, and hearing all the stories. We do this because every once in awhile we provide direction to those who truly need it. And of course you can always get your quarter back. results.description:
Meet other local fans of Ayn Rand and her philosophy Objectivism—a philosophy of Reason, Purpose, and Self-Esteem that holds human life on this Earth as the standard of all values and your life as an end in itself instead of a means to the ends of others.

You are invited, if you are a rational person who:

  • values reason, integrity, independence, and productive work;
  • holds that no one may initiate the use of force against others and a proper government is necessary to secure it;
  • deals with others as traders who honestly and voluntarily (and thus mutually) seek their own benefits;
  • regards one's own rational self-interest as the highest moral purpose of life, with no obligation or morality to sacrifice oneself to others or sacrifice others to oneself.

The goal of this meetup is to help local Objectivists:

  • socialize and expand their friend networks;
  • become more successful and productive;
  • enjoy life, be happy, and remain healthy;
  • improve the general culture in which we have to live and the free country which we love.

We meet at least monthly for various activities—lectures, discussions, trying new restaurants, enjoying arts and museums, outdoors, etc, and the format is usually casual, intellectual, and always civil and rational.

If you are not yet familiar with Objectivism but are interested in learning more about Ayn Rand's ideas, about laissez-faire capitalism, about the free society, about happiness and self-improvement, or about morality and philosophy in general, you are also welcome and will find many intelligent, fun, and friendly Objectivists to talk to.
results.name: New York Objectivists

REAL is eating where the international communities of New York eat when they want a taste of home.

REAL is eating what they eat.

REAL is taking your senses on an adventure around the globe without leaving New York City.

REAL is supporting small restaurants.  All bills will be paid the old-fashioned way, cash only.

REAL is being yourself. Talk about food. Talk about work. Talk about love. Talk about the world. Talk about anything. Just keep it real. But don't forget to laugh your ass off.

REAL is not a Fear Factor challenge. We will not be eating spicy frog buttocks or mad cow brains tartare. Unless it's delicious, of course.

The Organizer will research the cuisine and, whenever possible, taste test the restaurant and select dishes that highlight a variety of cooking techniques and authentic flavors. Beware - spicy foods will be spicy.

Everyone has their kryptonite, but you are responsible for your own dietary restrictions, allergies, health and general welfare. Dinners will be family-style; everyone will pay an equal share of the final food bill. You will be responsible for paying for your own drinks and individual desserts.

Each dinner will be limited to one table. Please honor your RSVP. Stuff happens. Same day cancellations are acceptable, but abusers of the RSVP process will be dealt with severely or at least removed from the group.

An open mind with a robust sense of humor is appreciated, but please be respectful and courteous. Everyone is welcome once, but not everyone is welcome twice. Behave now.

GET REAL. YOU KNOW YOU WANT TO.
results.name: Real Global Dining

results.description:
Welcome to Stone Age Mountain Bikers.  Originally started to give mountain bikers, over forty, somewhere to ride in a noncompetetive atmosphere.  It has grown over the past two years to include riders of all ages and skill levels.  The basic philosophy has not changed,  group rides where everyone sticks together, no one gets left behind.   We post rides of all difficulty levels from beginner to advanced.  The ride descriptions help guide members to the ride that's best for them.  As a club it is equally as important for our members to get there challenging rides in as well as rides that help beginners get started or advance and get better.  Stone Age is set up as s forum,  as long as you have been on a ride with us and share our philosophies, you can post your own rides.  As the organizer, I reserve the right to cancel any ride posted if I feel it is not "Stone Age"  See below what the criteria is .

   Being Stone Age has become more or an attitude than a club to belong to.  Basic philosophies include...

-Be nice

-Everyone rides what they ride. As long as the brakes brake and the gears shift and the tires have air, your good.   Keep in mind Mountain Bikes are needed. Hybrid or road bikes usually end up being pushed or getting someone hurt.

-be a trail steward.  Don't ride on  muddy trails.  Clear the trails of trash and fallen trees when possible.  Help other riders you find, in need.

- Encourage instead of insult.  We all had to start somewhere. 

- Respect other trail users.  Give them the right of way, always give a friendly greeting,  you not only represent Stone Age, but you represent all mountain Bikers in this area.  

Lastly, to be considerate to the other members you will be riding with,  show up at the Meetup site ready to go.  The Meetup spot is not the place to start maintaining, repairing, cleaning your bike.  Their will always be members to help out if you don't know how to do something on your bike, but making a habit of this, is not great.  Bring what you need for the ride.  You NEED to bring a bike, helmet, water and anything you might need to make you self sufficient.    Keep in mind, you are responsible for your own safety and equipment.  Mountain Biking is an inherently dangerous activity. Thus the use of helmets and pads.  Stone Age MTB and Meetup.com are not responsible for you or your equipment.  All your decisions and actions are totally your own responsibility.  Act and decide what to ride, or not ride, accordingly.  We will always give you realistic assessments of the trails and your abilities, if you need help figuring it out.  We will try not to let you get in over your head when possible.  

   Hope to see you on the trails.                     Barry
results.name: Stone Age Mountain Bikers

results.description:
Basecamp + Brooklyn (where I am based) = BaseKamp.  However, this group is for all NYC, Tri-state & beyond mountain freaks interested in the following:

1. Peakbagging the 4,000 footers in New England and in New York: NE115 (The Northeast 115 4k's), NH48, ADK46, and to a slightly lesser extent NEHH (New England Highest Hundred) & Catskill 35.

2. Speed or ultra hiking long distance trails, e.g., the Presidential & Great Range traverses, White Mountain Hut-to-Hut, Devil's Path, Long Path, Long Trail, NPT (The Northville-Lake Placid TR), AT, PCT, etc., as well as backpacking them.

3. Mountaineering and technical climbing.

4. Exploratory outings such as caving and spelunking.

This group is set up so that any member can post events, and we are a peer group in the fairest sense.  Everyone carries their own weight, and can lead as well as participate in an event.  As a member, you are encouraged to lead at least one event every quarter (Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter) or four times a year.

We have a strict attendance policy, and zero tolerance for any inappropriate behavior, which makes our group a safe haven for considerate, like-minded, smart and self-reliant adventurists in two boots.

Please read our group policy before joining: http://www.meetup.com/BASEKAMP/pages/Group_policy

By joining, you have agreed to: http://www.meetup.com/BASEKAMP/about/

If you are a cyclist and interested in cycling adventures, please join our sister group: http://www.meetup.com/Bike-to-Adventure/

results.description:
Prometheus is the ancient Athenian (Greek) god of technology and a divine rebel.

The Shrine of Prometheus is a group of Pagans, polytheists, occultists, and others who revere Prometheus, either as an actual deity or as a symbol, or who have a strong interest in science and technology. We also welcome anyone with an interest in how science and technology relate to spirituality. Our aims include:

1) To educate ourselves and other polytheists and occultists about a variety of topics pertaining to science/technology and spirituality.

2) To foster a sense of community among polytheists and occultists with a strong interest in science and technology, whether professional or amateur, and to facilitate professional networking among polytheists and occultists who work in technical fields.

3) To develop rituals and other activities to honor Prometheus and to foster our own technological creativity and problem-solving ability.

For now, we'll hold informal discussion meetings of our own, plus occasional trips to museums and to relevant events held by other organizations. Later, when we have enough regularly-attending members, we'll also hold more structured events of our own, including rituals.

For more information, please see our "About" page:  http://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Shrine-of-Prometheus/about/ .
results.name: NYC Shrine of Prometheus

results.description: This Meetup is designed to help people of all ages enrich their social relationships, increase creativity, enhance spontaneity, and meet new friends. This is not a superficial singles discussion; it’s an exclusive social experience based on the concepts of Erich Fromm, Abraham Maslow, Karen Horney,  Albert Ellis, and other greats in humanistic philosophy and psychology. The philosopher Martin Buber said that life is an encounter with oneself, others and nature, but we need to have these encounters enhance warmth, mutual understanding and health. In this series of Meet-ups, on the third Friday of each month, we will explore all the many aspects of interaction and relationships that ultimately make our lives more gratifying and effective. With guidance from an experienced group moderator, participants will create an experiential dialogue of sharing and learning, followed by relaxed socializing and light refreshments. The program is based on many years of highly successful development at the Humanist Foundation; its leader and counselor Joseph B. David has professionally conducted hundreds of humanist growth workshops and seminars. The hectic pace and complexities of today’s life make this program a welcome setting for meeting like-minded people and exploring ideas together.
results.name: Humanistic Interpersonal Meetup

results.description:
Let's be honest, it's hard being a single mother. It's even more difficult being a single mother to special needs kids. 'NYC Single Mothers with Special Needs Children' is a group dedicated to bring together moms who are single and raising special needs children alone for whatever the reason may be. Even if you are a mom who isn't single but feels there is a lack of family support, this is the place for you.

This group is not exclusive, it is just a group to help us find each other among all of the single parents groups, and parents with special needs groups. We have a specific situation and it is beneficial to meet others in the same boat. This group is for support, sharing information, and you and your child(ren)'s stories. Meet ups will be difficult I know, but we will make them happen.

Check out our various social media tools so that we can keep in touch (these are phone apps as well):

• Explore our Facebook Group to really connect with people: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1378449235730774/

• Follow us on Twitter and tweet about what we do: https://twitter.com/NyMomsOfSNC

• Join our slack group for discussions and advice: https://nycsinglemomsofsnc.slack.com

• We are working on creating a subreddit on reddit.com in the future: stay tuned.

results.description:
Zentangle® is an easy to learn, relaxing way to create beautiful pieces of art using the "Anything is Possible, One Stroke at a Time"® method. This group is open to those interested in learning about this fascinating, meditative style and those already practicing it as a Life Skill.  I am a Certified Zentangle Teacher (CZT) and have been teaching Zentangle workshops here on Long Island since 2009.  In addition to my own workshops, I am a teacher at the Art League of Long Island.  You can get details for my workshops held there at www.artleagueli.org  

I hope we will be meeting in a variety of locations,days and times and sharing our passion for this unique art form.  Using focus and repetitive patterns, we'll be making small pieces of art using beautiful handmade paper and pigment ink pens.  There will be a wide variety of classes from introductory to Zendalas, Illuminated letters, journaling, and even developing our own tangles (patterns).

If you are interested, let me know what days and times work best for you and I'll do my best to set something up that will work for you.  You may bring friends, but they must be registered (if they are with you, they do not have to be a member of this MeetUp group).

And finally, if you want to host a Zentangle class for your friends and family in your own home or at your workplace, I can discuss details with you in a private message or phone call.

results.description: We are the Greater New York Independent Publishers Association (“GNYIPA”), a small, select professional level group of people involve with book publishing, writing, book design, book promotion, and self publishing. Our published works comprise a wide range of subjects and genres, including: non-fiction, fiction, self-help, history, LGBT literature, art, photography, playwrights, memoirs, children’s books, and other genres. You do not need to be a published author to join GNYIPA, but you need to have as professional attitude about yourself and your work. GYUIPA meetings are not the place to hustle your work, tell us all of your opinions, and be disruptive. We are looking for people to join GNYIPA who can be an asset the group, who value working with a group, and who have time and energy to give to our projects such as readings, book fairs and events, etc. What we can offer you is real support in the extremely difficult environment of publishing today. If you feel that this kind of group is for you, then we will welcome you as a guest to your first meeting. To attend a second meeting, you will have to be invited to join, after filling out a membership form. Be advised: we are a working group of professionals in the book world, so our meetings deal with professionalism and how to maintain it. They are not simply entertainment. Potential authors who are progressing on their manuscripts and are considering self-publishing their work are welcome to attend.  We meet on the first Wednesday of each month at a midtown location. To find out the location, you need to be invited by the organizer of this group.

VentureOutNY is focused on helping to enable international startups to launch and succeed in New York City. Based on the philosophy that talent is evenly distributed but opportunity is not, VentureOutNY’s mission is to bridge that gap between the entrepreneurial talent abroad to the vast opportunities in burgeoning technology community in New York.

Through regionally focused events, VentureOutNY introduce the world’s most talented international entrepreneurs to the startup ecosystem in NYC, fast tracking their growth by helping establish relationships with the most relevant investors, entrepreneurs and partners in New York City.

VentureOutNY was founded by Brian Frumberg in 2011 with the help of partner Jennifer Charlton, Community & Communications Manager for the Consulate of Switzerland.

Please visit www.ventureoutny.com to learn more.
results.name: VentureOutNY

results.description:
The Brighter Future Society (BFS) is a group of motivated young professionals who are committed to promoting the mission of the YAI Network through social service. YAI is a Manhattan-based not-for-profit organization that provides serviBy volunteering in programs or out in the community alongside YAI program participants, BFS members cultivate relationships, raise much-needed funds and support our goal of true community inclusion.

BFS members have a wide range of professional backgrounds in publicity, design and media, finance, the arts, hotels, hospitality and more. The common thread of this diverse group: members really want to make a difference. You can too.

There are many opportunities to get involved:

    Weekly arts & crafts, basketball, bowling and other recreational activities that encourage socialization, build relationships and self-esteem

    Sponsor supplies or lessons for an artist in the YAI Arts program

    Help plan social events such as holiday parties, museum trips and concert outings for YAI participants or organize a fundraiser on behalf of YAI

    Provide job shadowing or internships for YAI employment graduates who are prepared for meaningful work

    Network with other young professionals who share a passion for philanthropy

 

You can make a difference. Join us today! For more information about the Brighter Futures Society, contact Alyssa Franklin at 212-273-6551 or alyssa.franklin@yai.org.
results.name: YAI Brighter Futures Society

results.description:
Nyeek is a social get together for board game enthusiasts in the New York City area. If that sounds kind of geeky let me assure you that it absolutely is.

We play all types of board games (abstract, party, thematic), but we tend to lean towards Euro Games. Games that usually have simple rules, relatively short playing times, and no player elimination, so they’re pretty accessible to newcomers.

If you want to know more feel free to check out the (still being written) FAQ, but in a nutshell we're just a fun loving board game group.  Come out and play some games some time!

You are interested in the world around you, want a variety of activities for you and your children, and are proud of your choice of at-home mothering for your families! We know, because we're at-home mothers, too! We meet during the day, when at-home mothers most need support! results.description:
Welcome to Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society!
Founded in 1980, Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society is a not-for-profit, community-based organization for LGBT people in the NY-NJ-CT tri-state region who enjoy participating in non-competitive outdoor activities. The purpose of the club is to organize various outdoor and cultural activities and to enjoy the great outdoors with each other!

Learn about Sundance through photos and articles in our newsletter:

Go to 'More' and click on 'Files' to see recent issues of the "Crosswinds", the Sundance newsletter.

Our Mission Statement

    To provide non-competitive outdoor activities for the enjoyment of GLBT people.

    To foster the meeting of like-minded people and encourage a sense of community.

    To encourage an appreciation and respect for the natural world.

    We're a  fun, inclusive and friendly club that's been around since 1980! Everyone is welcome.

    There are well over 100 outings organized each year. Some examples of outings are:

    Hiking in the Catskills

    Bike riding in the Hamptons

    Paddling the Hackensack on an Ecotour

    Visiting the Museum of Modern Art

    Cross-country Skiing in Vermont

    Backpacking in the Adirondacks

    Canoeing in Canada

    Camping at an LGBT Campground

What are some special advantages that Sundance offers over other venues?

    We’re an all-volunteer organization. No one gets paid for anything they do in Sundance.

    We offer lots of outings, in great variety - There are events for all levels - easy to advanced.

    We’re a full service organization: Leaders are well organized and plan everything for their outing, from recommending equipment to helping to arrange carpools, to planning the trip.

    Sundance can front any deposits needed by outing leaders (e.g. for outfitter costs).

    Camaraderie of a club: Over time, as you attend more outings, you’ll meet and get to know members. Many members have formed life-long friendships in our club.

    Consistency and reliability of the outings: All outing submissions go through a review process and are vetted by Team Captains and our Outings Director.

    We have a lot of experience in handling unforeseen events that come up on outings (these are documented in our member/ leadership handbook.)

    The club funds leadership safety training courses for leaders each year.

    Sundance is incorporated with the State of New York. As a result, we adhere to NYS’ laws governing not-for-profit corporations, such as holding elections and maintaining financial records, and maintaining a fully staffed Board of Directors.

    Our mailing address is:

    Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society
    208 W. 13th St.
    New York, NY 10011-7702
results.name: Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society

results.description:
This is a relaxed "No Attitude" small (now larger) Social Community of Gay Catholics, Christians & Friends - Regardless of  Where You Find Yourself in "Your Own Personal Spiritual Journey."  

Our events are mainly Social and Current Affairs Discussion  gatherings with specific interest on discussing current issues affecting Gay Catholics and Christians.  Our events include topic-related Current Event Casual Chats; Movies; Jazz Mass; Dinners; Mass & Sports Bar; Theater; Guest Speakers; Book Readings; Music/Concert; Picnics; Walks; Sunset-Watch; Volunteer Projects/Events and others. 

There is no fee to join the community and most events are free, but if there are any costs associated with events planned - they will be included in the event posting (ie, movie, theater, speaker, etc)

• For Members far away or unable to physically attend the events, we also hold online chats, video calls & "free online course" events with group discussions on member-suggested topics.  If you would like to set up an event closer to you or your parish, let us know and we will help you organize it.

• For Churches & Organizations Near or Far: If you would like us to share some of your LGBTQ Ministry & Outreach events with the group, please reach out to the group's organizers with a brief description & date/time/rsvp specifics of the event; along with your contact info(email/phone) for event verification.

Group's Volunteer "COMMUNITY OUTREACH" Initiatives Include:

• New FREE Proximity-based "Gay Catholics Christians" Mobile APP: Download the Group's "Free" Mobile App  on Google Play Apps , Apple's iTunes App Store, Amazon App Store, HTML5 & other major Mobile App Stores. The free mobile app was recently developed and launched by volunteers from the group, and it is now one of the fastest growing Catholic Mobile Apps on Google Play, Apple's iTunes App Store & others.

• New BOOK: University Chronicle - "God's Black Porsche: Dating Stories from NYC's Gay Catholics & Christians" - New Book of Gay Catholics & Christians Dating Stories on Challenges of Balancing Faith, Values & Sex in NYC.

results.description:
I’m starting this group to gauge interest in Tarot Classes offered in the Wall Street area. I will be using TRS Professional Suites at 40 Exchange Place as the classroom venue. Please join this group if you live or work in an area that is convenient to Wall Street and you would like to take Tarot classes at TRS. The evenings I will offer classes will be Tuesday, Thursday, or Friday. Class cost will be $17 in advance or $20 at the door for a two-hour class.

Whether you are a Tarot newbie, or already have knowledge of Tarot, you can learn techniques of interpretation that you can apply to any spread or use with your favorite Tarot deck. Rather than learning spreads or memorizing standard card meanings, you will learn techniques of interpretation that will allow the cards to speak to you and allow your own intuition to guide you to the truth.

The class works best for students who bring a Rider Waite, Universal Waite, or other versions of the Waite deck to class, but they are also encouraged to bring other decks as many of the interpretive techniques are transferable.
results.name: New York Intuitive Tarot Classes – Wall Street Edition

results.description:
This group was originally formed to make its way through the book "Seven Languages in Seven Weeks: A Pragmatic Guide to Learning Programming Languages," by Bruce Tate. The book is a quick deep-dive into seven very different languages: Ruby, Io, Prolog, Scala, Erlang, Clojure and Haskell.

We found we enjoyed hearing about a new language every month, so much that we decided to continue the group after the end of the book. It seemed that there was a place for a group that gives programmer-level (but not too scary!) introductions to languages that members have always heard about but haven't ever delved into. Some languages are too obscure to have their own Meetup groups, but even for the ones that aren't, sometimes you want an overview of the key features of a language and what makes it special, which you might not always get at a Meetup devoted to that language, among people who are already familiar with it.

As of this writing, we've had talks on (in addition to the languages listed above) Python, OCaml, Go, JavaScript, Smalltalk, J, and Perl. If you've got a language you'd like to hear on intro on, join the group and make a suggestion!

We have a slack channel where we hang out and chat about programming languages, tech, and other related items. You can sign up for slack here:

results.description:
We are a community of foragers and friends gathering together and learning from each other in NY and NJ.

Mission
Our mission is to gather together as a community and have fun teaching, learning and practicing sustainable living through our wilderness adventures in our backyards and beyond.

Our Motto is "Gather Together".

We are fun, friendly, local, outdoors, sustainable, organic, wild, educational, teaching, healthy, healing, laughing, smiling, eating, creative, playful, nutritious and delicious. Gathering together with us is good for your soul ♥.

We offer memorable experiences of great food, fresh air and good company.

We schedule wild edibles walks and workshops on plant identification, harvesting, preparation, preservation, cooking, medicinal uses and dyes. We also schedule wilderness adventure workshops on primitive survival skills, such as emergency shelter building, fire making, trapping, cordage making, water purification, and hide tanning.

Our community of friends include foragers, mycologists, herbalists, hunters, anglers, permies, healers, farmers, foodies, survivalists, wild crafters, locavores, families, dreamers and more.

Check out our website and like our Facebook page for events and blogs about sustainable living.

http://www.suburbanforagers.com

www.facebook.com/SuburbanForagers

 

We are an *active* group and expect all of our members to be active participants. While we do not limit our membership, our focus is quality, not quantity. If members are not active, they may be removed from the group.  Please also post a real photo of yourself so that we know you are not a lurker.

Thank you for your interest. We look forward to meeting you soon.
results.name: Suburban Foragers of NY and NJ

I'm sure that this group will take on a life of its own once it gets started, but some topics that we could discuss include, but are not limited to: international/intercultural dating, customs in your country versus customs in the USA, international politics (let's not fight over this, however!), international travel & tourism, good books that you've read in your language, good movies to watch in your language, and good restaurants with authentic food from your country (or country you've lived in). results.description:
OUR MEETUPS ARE FREE, AND THERE WILL BE NO SALES OR PITCHING! ONLY INFORMATIVE AND CONTENT PACKED MEETINGS :-)

You probably realize your business needs some form of Internet  and/or Social Media Marketing, but no one can seem to explain to you how it all  works in plain English...  Or if you are an Entrepreneur and just want to learn how to build a BLOG – come to the Meetups and we'll all help each other figure it out. Even if you’re an experienced Internet Marketer, come and join the meetings so we can all trade useful tips and information.

We will trade information and tips on how "non-techy" small business owners & entrepreneurs can successfully use various methods of internet marketing to expand their businesses & access thousands of new clients at once.

Come to this Meetup if some of the questions below apply to you:

  • What is Internet Marketing / Social Media, and how is it used by businesses and Entrepreneurs?
  • Don't know where to start ...this is a good place to begin
  • Already have a website but feel it's not being used effectively as a business building tool?  Find out why, and how you can make it more effective by applying Internet Marketing, and Social Media, principles.
  • Unsure what exactly your web designer / marketer does with all the money you're paying them? Once you understand the basic concepts of Internet Marketing, you’ll be able to tell them exactly what you want done, but best of all – you’ll be able to do it yourself!
  • Are you ready to dominate your market in this competitive economy?  Now is the perfect time to do it, because very few small businesses are using Internet Marketing to their advantage.   Learn how to do get ahead from those who have done it, and are going it right now!

SOME OF THE TOPICS WE WILL DISCUSS

  1. Creating your Brand on the Internet
  2. Getting on Google: what is "Search Engine Optimization" (SEO) and how do I do it myself?
  3. How to get a top rankings on SEOs, so “all roads” lead to your website
  4. Social Media: What's Twitter, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  5. Social Media: What's Facebook, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  6. Social Media: What's LinkedIn, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  7. Social Media: What's YouTube, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  8. Social Media: What's Pinterest, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  9. Building a “Buyer/Seller List” with your website, and how do you use it in Interent Marketing
  10. Doing promotional launches and e-mail marketing campaigns
  11. Bring your own topic and questions you'd like to discuss

…and many more...

results.description:
Welcome to the OTD* Meetup!

We are a group of individuals from formerly Orthodox Jewish backgrounds who meet on a regular basis for good food, thoughtful conversation, and to make new friends. Most of us were raised with strong attachments to Jewish observance, but -while we are each on our own journey- now live mostly secular lives. Our past unites us, and we take from it what we still find meaningful, but we otherwise live simply as members of the world community.

We're a friendly bunch who are always eager to meet new people who relate to the interest of the OTD journey, whether formerly religious or just exploring. So feel free to request to join our group, and we'll let you know if you seem to be a fit.

At this time, we try to organize at least two events per month, one in NYC and one in Rockland-Bergen County. Events include but are not limited to: dining out, pot-luck dinners, meeting for a movie, attending musical performances, museums, live theater,  and other cultural events, or anything else our members are interested in. We're always looking for new experiences, so suggestions are welcome and encouraged.

We hope you will join us. If you have questions, please drop us a note by clicking the "Contact" button to the left.

Please note: while there is no fee to join our group, we ask that you contribute $1 per event (for events you choose to attend) in order to cover the meetup.com admin fee.

You must be a minimum of eighteen years of age to join our meetup events. Most events are adults-only. Some events are kids-friendly. Unless explicitly specified, event are adults-only.

(*OTD stands for "Off the Derekh"--or off the path of Orthodox observance.)


Screening process to protect group members identity:
-All group members can attend events taking place on Shabbat.
-Only “vouched” group members can attend events taking place on weekdays/weeknights.

How to become a “vouched” member (only one of the four options required):
[Please note: You do NOT need to break Shabbat in order to become a vouched member]

1) A current “vouched” group member vouches for you.
or
2) Attend a Shabbat meetup event.
or 
3) A Footsteps staff member vouches for you. 
or 
4) Meet in person with an organizer or an assigned vouched group member. 



OTDM was founded in loving memory of a beloved friend 
Rachel Nove
6/13/1980 - 1/28/2010
results.name: OTD Meetup: Social Events in New York City & Rockland-Bergen

results.description: Ever since I became a survivor twelve years ago after I found my mother when she committed suicide, I've wanted to find and spend time with others who can identify with the ways this tragic event has changed and shaped my life. Grief counseling groups were helpful for me in the early stages of my personal griefing process, but now that I've found peace with being a survivor I'd like to work to bring some of us together to be able to appreciate the people we've become and how we've changed from our personal experience with suicide. For me, this group is for survivors who are interested in a survivor social group to spend time with (coffee, drinks, movies, hiking, etc) as opposed to a pure grief counseling/support group. If the event is still very raw and/or recent for you, then I don't believe that this social group would be the group for you. There is an excellent support/griefing group that I've attended in NYC and you can get more information here: http://www.samaritansnyc.org/safeplace.html
results.name: Survivors of Suicide Social Gathering Group

results.description: The Society of Quantitative Analysts (SQA) is a not-for-profit organization that focuses on education and communication to support members of the quantitative investment practitioner community. We seek to encourage the dissemination of leading-edge ideas and innovations relevant to the work of the quantitative investment practitioner. The knowledge of such ideas and innovations can assist portfolio and risk managers, strategists, analysts, traders, regulators, asset owners such as pension sponsors and foundations in performing their functions and responding to the ever-quickening pace of change. The Society welcomes the participation of academics and students. The SQA provides forums for the presentation of theory and practice by practitioners, academics and regulators with an emphasis on the new and controversial. The Society holds monthly meetings in New York City from September through June. Monthly meetings consist of one-hour talks on a specific topic. The Society also organizes a half-day seminar in the fall on a topic of current interest and a full-day "Fuzzy Day" seminar in the spring on an exporatory topic.
results.name: Society of Quantitative Analysts - NYC

We explore how wealth is created and shared. We examine the impact of trade and technology on our economy. Our objective is to create jobs, raise incomes, provide affordable housing, and protect our environment.

results.description:
NY Career Meetup is a information and networking group that connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events.The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.

NY Career Meetup gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers.NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

NY Career Meetup provides great opportunity for Job search networking Or Career Networking.60% of all jobs are found by networking. It's true, some of the best jobs are never advertised. Many are filled by successful job seekers who networked with the right people and got the job before it was ever advertised. Employers love referrals and first look to tap their own workers for people they know that can fill open positions. It's cheaper and provides for more quality employees. People do business primarily with people they k9now and like. Resumes and cover letters alone are often too impersonal to convince employers to hire. Networking makes you a recommended member of a much smaller pool. Networking leads to information and job leads, often before a formal job description is created or a job is announced. There is more to successful networking than just talking to your friends. To be a successful networker you must have as many contacts as possible hear your pitch and understand that you are in the job market.

FB LINK - https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup
results.name: NY Career Meetup

results.description:
This is an exclusive networking group for Wedding Professionals who serve the high-end wedding market in Manhattan. There are three requirements to be a part of this meetup group.

  1. You provide professional services to brides and grooms.
  2. You serve the high-end wedding market.
  3. You are based in the New York City area (you can have offices/outlets in other locations).

 

This is a business networking group for wedding/bridal professionals in the categories Accommodations, Bridal Fashions, Bridal Jewelry, Bridal Party, Bridal Party Gifts, Cakes, Catering, Ceremony Sites, Dance Lessons, Decorations, DJ, Entertainment, Event Insurance, Favors, Flowers, For the Men, Health & Beauty, Honeymoon, Invitations, Live Music, Officiants, Photo Booth Rentals, Photographers, Pre-wedding Events, Premarital Counseling, Real Estate, Registry, Rehearsal Dinner, Rentals, Transportation, Travel Agencies, Tuxedos & Suits, Venues, Videography & Film, Wedding Planners etc., who serve the Manhattan high-end wedding market. The high-end wedding market is around 4% of the overall wedding market and typically constitutes of weddings with a budget of $100,000 or higher. 2011 saw 5,476 such weddings in Manhattan, with a total spending of approximately $820 million.

The idea behind creating this group is to get together a small group (preferably only one or two members from a category) of top of the line wedding professionals who use group synergy to capture the largest share of the Manhattan high-end wedding market. Individuals are like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist. The advantages of numbers is huge. When operating as a group, or I must say, as a TEAM, 1 and 1 is not 2. It is actually 11. Eventually this will be a closed group where members will vote on other members so that the group on the whole will always have the best.

-----------------------------------------

How could you have a soccer team if all were goalkeepers? How would it be an orchestra if all were French horns?  -- Desmond Tutu


The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side. -- Margaret Carty

------------------------------------------
results.name: Manhattan Wedding Professionals

results.description:
Hoboken Young Professionals("HYP") was formed to bring driven and passionate young professionals together every month.  We at HYP believe that developing and nurturing your professional network is the cornerstone to success.  Luckily, we already have all the young talent we need right here in the area.  Here are a few quick points so you understand what HYP is all about:

1. What happens at these events? We typically set a time at a bar in Hoboken to hold very informal meetings.  There is no agenda other than to meet other professionals, hold engaging conversations and have a few drinks.

2. Is there suggested dress attire? Clothes have no barring on the quality of networking.  It is very common to see members in jeans or shorts.

3. Should I bring something to the event? We usually have some very interesting people in attendance with diverse careers.  We suggest you bring some new ideas or talking points.  You never know where your next career altering insight will flourish from so mix it up!

4. Any advice? If you are involved in sales please refrain from attending in hopes of generating quick business.  A member's main focus should be to give to the group and let relationships develop naturally.

5. Who is considered a young professional? For purposes of the group it is 40 and below.  However, no one is going to be asking your age ;).

6. Do I have to live in Hoboken to attend an event? Absolutely not.  It is very common for members to be from the surrounding towns or the city.
results.name: HOBOKEN YOUNG PROFESSIONALS

results.description:
Members of W. A. Nyland’s Chardavogne Group will hold a series of meetings in Manhattan starting in September of 2014.  Discussion will focus on how the ideas of Gurdjieff relate to an individual’s spiritual development in today’s complex and turbulent world. Mr. Nyland was a serious student and teacher of Gurdjieff’s ideas for over 50 years, andtoday his group continues, providing a vital source for the study and practice of work on oneself.

EVERYONE IS WELCOME!

For the time and place of these meetings call the Chardavogne Barn at 845-258-4655 For more information regarding G.I. Gurdjieff and W.A. Nyland visit http://www.nyland.org

In 1924 Mr. Nyland heard Gurdjieff speak during his first visit to United States, and soon became an active member of the new group set up by Gurdjieff in New York, with A.R. Orage at the head. From that beginning, Mr. Nyland became dedicated to the practical application of Gurdjieff’s Ideas for the rest of his life. He traveled several times to France to work with Gurdjieff, helped Gurdjieff when he made his various tater trips to America, and continued with his own personal efforts to apply what Gurdjieff taught as self-development, or work on oneself.

Near the end of his life, Gurdjieff asked Mr. Nyland to start a group in America, for which he would receive special material every week. After Gurdjieff died in 1949, Mr. Nyland was one of the founders and trustees of the Gurdjieff Foundation. He remained active in the Foundation until he formed his own independent group in the early 1960s.

In the late 1960s, Mr. Nyland established a center in the country, in Warwick, NY, where he purchased property now known as Chardavogne Barn. His group in California also purchased property in Sonoma county, near San Francisco, now known as The Land. At these and other branches of his group, he conducted many meetings, Gurdjieff movements, and workdays for physical activities. His group continues today with these activities.
results.name: Mr Nyland's Chardavogne Gurdjieff group New York

results.description:
I'm Gregg Festa, an innovative teacher, high school principal, edtech teacherprenuer and author of the RE@LWorldEDTECH blog.  I have assumed the organizer role for this meetup group as of March 27, 2016. In doing so, I have revised the name to Tri-State Education Innovators so it is inclusive of all those in NY/NJ/CT working hard to innovate in education from the inside AND outside. 

As a veteran educator and entrepreneur with a combined 20 years of successful and not so successful experience leading innovation in education , I've found that the most useful aspect of meet ups is the symbiotic relationships developed among its diverse membership and the resultant outcomes that occur from those interactions. Going forward, I will focus our monthly meetups on bringing the brightest minds inside and outside of education together to share ideas, concepts and real world practice with the purpose of disruptively innovating the learning space. If there are those in the group who would like to participate in organizing meetups with a focus on the current trends in the learning space (makerspaces, STEM, open source learning resources, design thinking, innovative learning spaces, blended learning, personalized and adaptive learning, LMS, etc) please be sure to reach out to me so we can collaborate around your idea.

In the meantime, I will be working hard to create and host one of the following monthly meetup formats each month beginning in late April (date TBD) .

1) Innovator Speed Dating - Startups /Teacherprenuers can test their ideas/prototypes through a 10 minute demo and discuss while gaining valuable and constructive development feedback from veteran educators. Let's see whose idea makes it the alter. 

2) Innovation in the Round - This Socratic meetup format will give participants an opportunity to submit, discuss and debate real world problems in education, while proposing solutions that may or may not disruptively innovate learning now or in the future. Let's find out together! 

I am also working to jumpstart what I am confident will be an annual summer "must go to" event for educators, teacherprenuers and EdTech startups. Sort of the South by Southwest for Education Innovators. I envision that this meetup will be based on the organic podcamp model where those attending will create their own learning experience based on interest and knowledge/skills as they go. I am open to all the help I can get to plan and facilitate this experience as Summer is almost here and there is much to be done. 

As always, we will be seeking sponsorship to help defray the costs for our important and valuable events. Please contact me if you or someone you know is willing to throw some dollars our way in return for shameless promotion to some of the loudest and most heard voices in education today. I look forward to meeting you all!

Gregg
results.name: Tri State Education Innovators

topics.name: Market Your Small Business Locally On The Internet
Local Internet Marketing For Small Business

results.description:
Who We Are
Do you have technology questions? Technology solutions?  Websites, apps, marketing, OH MY!  It can be overwhelming for the small to medium business owner.  I say, let's get this party started and help each other network, prosper and GROW! Who knows what might be waiting for you around the corner.

What We Do
Presentation, discussions and round tables, we provide a forum for members and invited guests to share their business challenges and knowledge, and to present their expertise, projects, problems and solutions.

Who Should Join
"Local businesses looking to grow". This can be national chains or individual proprietorships. Those who will get the most out of the group will be owners and executives looking to use emerging technologies to  give them an edge in the marketplace.

"Tech entrepreneurs solving local business challenges" can be founders or executives of startups or leaders of internal innovation units of established corporations who are developing new technologies that will help local businesses better reach and serve their customers.  You can also be a local business owner who wants a leg up on the competition.

We will aim to have a balance of members from both communities, and to invite presenters and panelists from a cross-section of relevant businesses and fields of expertise.
results.name: TECH DRIVEN NYC

results.description: Do you love literature and perhaps music and art as well--but somehow you’ve never really “got” poetry? Would you like to learn to get the joy from poems you get from other works of art without going through English Lit 101 again? If your answers are yes I can help. It started with a friend whom I met in discussion groups of Joyce’s Ulysses and Proust’s Remembrance of Things Past. He loved literature and music (he was a Jazz musician and is very knowledgeable about classical music as well). Yet, though he knew there was great beauty in poetry, he just didn’t “get” it. We started discussing poetry in general and soon began weekly discussions of specific great poems. The challenge for me was how to make poetry come alive to him yet cover the critical components of poetry in a meaningful and interesting way—to help him enjoy the beauty in Poetry that he enjoyed so much in literature and music. These discussions have been a great success and a great joy to both of us. He has come to love poetry with the same passion he has felt for music and literature. Now I’d like to share with others what we learned. So, I am starting a Peotry discussion group—I will facilitate but it’ll be discussions not lectures or lessons. Together we will learn to understand and then love great poems. If you are interested, just join the Great Poetry group on Meetup. As soon as we have 5 or more members I will contact you and we’ll pick a schedule and a venue in Manhattan and then we’ll start. Larry Schiff
results.name: Great Poetry: read /discuss / learn to love--in Mahattan

topics.name: Startups meet VCs and Angel Investors

results.description:
Having visited a lot of business Meetups, we saw a lot of great people with great ideas. Some of them have already started their first companies, others are just thinking of doing it, and others trying to promote their companies’ products or services. There are also plenty of talented people who are looking for investors and business networking.

We will help you get necessary information to develop and promote your startup in a more effective way. We hope we will help you get financial resources for your growing business. At our Meetup, you will always be able to find useful information about internet marketing, ideas on how to advertise your business, information about upcoming Meetups and, of course, information about NY startups.

We also cooperate with New York companies that provide services for startups.

Breakfast Networking can help you promote your services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome salespeople, entrepreneurs, individual practitioners and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each other’s professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:
- develop a sales plan
- develop a marketing plan
- with finances
- with HR issues
- secure speaking engagements
- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums
- meet other key people and partners
- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (917-862-8929) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM. Then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once a month we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors
1290 Avenue of the Americas, 4th Floor
(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast Networking event.

We are part of 5 other meetup groups. Please check them out and join:

results.description:
The NY-North Jersey Chapter of AMC has something for everyone who loves to explore the outdoors on foot. For beginners or experts. In the city or far from the bustle.
What sets us apart?
• Trained leaders means trips are organized AND fun
• Easy access on public transportation to tons of our hikes
• Hikes are open to anyone (as long as you meet fitness and equipment requirements)
This MeetUp group is sponsored by the NY-North Jersey Chapter of the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC). AMC members take part in virtually every outdoor activity under the sun: from hiking to paddling and from softball to skiing. All while protecting the waters, mountains, and forests of Northeast outdoors.
Can’t get enough? Check out all of our chapter events at http://www.amc-ny.org/information/schedule.....
Not a member? Join us today! http://www.amc-ny.org/information/join
Already a dues-paying AMC member? Join our last minute hike listserv! Just send your name and member number to hikeamc-subscribe@yahoogroups.com.
results.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
Being a parent is tough.  Being a parent in NYC is really tough.  But being a geek parent in NYC can be amazingly fun.

This group is for geeks who are parents, as well as parents whose kids are natural born geeks. Let's meet and discuss the fascinating challenges of raising kids with a focus on science and smarts, and do some of the cool geeky things available about town.

We (the organizers) have a six month old son, so we'll try to plan events centered around small children, but please feel free to join and create events for older kids.  Besides, all geeks are just curious kids in grownup bodies!
results.name: New York Geek Parents
